trait.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: The Wizard's spells don't harm its allies.

action.name: Power Word: Kill (1/Day, 9th level spell)
entries: 60 ft range, 1 target. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, the spell has no effect.

action.name: Sunburst (1/Day, 8th level spell)

On a failed save, the target takes 47 ({@damage 12d6 + 5}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} for a minute, or half damage on a success. A {@condition blinded} target makes a {@dc 19} CON save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Teleport (1/Day, 7th level spell)

action.name: Sleep (1/Day, 1st level spell)
entries: Roll {@dice 5d8}, the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points. Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points.

variant.name: Note: Tracking Resources
entries: With shared pools of limited resources, like Ki and Metamagic, I've tried to allocate them based on typical usage in a 3-6 round fight. Once the stat blocks get to a level where they're not likely to run out, I stop bothering to track them, because you should only take on more bookkeeping load when and if it benefits your game.

variant.name: Note: Sneak Attack is 1/turn
entries: Remember that the strongest use of your reaction as a Rogue is often Attacks of Opportunity, because sneak attack is 1/turn, not 1/round.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, targets a creature the rogue has advantage against, or one adjacent to an ally of the Rogue's. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, targets a creature the rogue has advantage against, or one adjacent to an ally of the Rogue's. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage

bonus.name: Cunnning Action
entries: The Rogue dashes, disengages, or hides.

variant.name: Note: Why only sneak attack?
entries: A rogue that can't get sneak attack should use its bonus action to hide or dash to flank. A rogue that still can't get sneak attack should use their action to try to set up sneak attack next turn.

variant.name: Note: Why a Shortsword rather than Rapier?
entries: It lets you use all one die size, and the same dice for ranged and melee. The difference between a {@dice d6} and a {@dice d8} is 1 DPR. Don't worry about it.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: On its first turn each combat, the Ranger has +10 movement speed. If it Attacks on that turn, it can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage.

entries: The Ranger's attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover, and don't suffer disadvantage for creatures being within 5 feet.

trait.name: Stalker's Flurry (1/Turn)
entries: When the Ranger misses with an attack, it can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

entries: The Ranger makes its next attack at advantage, its next attack does an additional {@damage 1d8} damage, its speed increases by 30 feet, and it does not provoke attacks of opportunity this turn.

variant.name: Note: Ambushes
entries: Ambushes are a fun tool to use as a DM, but their primary use is in turning an easy encounter into a hard one. In a "fair" encounter using PC-like enemies, a successful ambush is very likely to TPK your party in a way that your players won't feel good about. If you still really want to do one, give Pass Without Trace to your Rangers and Druids.

action.name: Snare, 2nd level spell (1/Day)
entries: The Ranger designates a 5 foot radius circle that it touches. The first time a creature steps into the circle, the trap is triggered. The triggering creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw or or fall {@condition prone} and be hoisted into the air where it hangs upside down 3 feet above the protected surface, where it is {@condition restrained}.
The {@condition restrained} creature can make a Dexterity saving throw with disadvantage at the end of each of its turns and ends the {@condition restrained} effect on a success.

bonus.name: Zephyr Strike, 1st level spell, concentration (4/Day)
entries: The Ranger makes its next attack at advantage, its next attack does an additional {@damage 1d8} damage, its speed increases by 30 feet, and it does not provoke attacks of opportunity this turn.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher

action.name: Longbow

variant.name: Note: Ranger Spells
entries: Hunters Mark is fine, but its real value past level 5 is in conserving spell slots. Zephyr Strike is more generally useful for the kinds of situations a Ranger facing your party is going to have to deal with.

Ranger spells in general are really good, but at  higher levels they either can't justify their complexity or they get severely outclassed by the raw power of just attacking. This is why the Ranger Legend only has a single spell prepared.

variant.name: Note: Why Longbow rather than Light Crossbow?
entries: The longbow is iconic, and a lot of the things that make a Ranger feel like a Ranger are bonus-action hungry.

reaction.name: Opportunity attack
entries: As a reaction, the Paladin may make a Halberd attack then move up to half its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity under any of the following conditions:
When a creature enters its reach
When a creature leaves its reach
When a creature within 5 feet of makes an attack against a target other than it.
If the attack hits, the creature's movement speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the turn.

reaction.name: Soul of Vengeance
entries: As a reaction, the Paladin may make a Halberd attack against a creature under the effect of its Vow of Enmity when that creature makes an attack.

variant.name: Note: Paladins are Complex
entries: Something I discovered putting this project together is that of all the classes, Paladins are the most irreducible. Which is to say, on any given turn in combat they have the most viable options for how to use their Action, Bonus Action, and Reaction. I really didn't expect that, to be honest. Even more so, if you take into account Find Greater Steed.

variant.name: Note: Find Greater Steed
entries: A high level paladin should always be riding something cool. Give them whatever CR 2 creature fits thematically to ride, then have it act on their turn. If you were already going to be using a more powerful monster in the encounter, have them riding that instead and have them act on the same turn in initiative.

variant.name: Note: Summoning Spells
entries: Summmoning spells are often the strongest offensive spells that a given class has access to, particularly for Bards, Druids, and Rangers. I haven't put them on any of these stat blocks because they slow combat down, they don't usually make for super memorable moments, and they require referencing other rules that you may not have handy. Feel free to swap them in if you feel up to it, though.

action.name: Hypnotic Patern (1/Day, 3rd level spell, concentration)
entries: 120 ft range, 30 ft cube, {@dc 15} WIS save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. Ends early if the target takes damage or is shaken out of it with an action.

action.name: Hold Person (1/Day, 3rd level spell, concentration)
entries: 60 ft range, 2 targets, {@dc 15} WIS save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. Target repeats the save at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Blindness (1/Day, 3rd level spell)
entries: 30 ft range, {@dc 15} CON save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded}. Target repeats the save at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

variant.name: Note: Multiattack vs Full Action Economy
entries: If I expect a creature to take the same bonus action every turn, I include it in the multiattack. If a creature has multiple competing bonus actions, I add a seperate section for them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bard attacks once with its Bow, and uses its Inspire ability. It may replace its Bow attack with a spell.

action.name: Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Inspire
entries: One friendly creature within 60 feet adds a {@dice d6} to their next {@dice D20} roll.

action.name: Blindness (1/Day, 2nd level spell)
entries: 30 ft range, {@dc 13} CON save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded}. Target repeats the save at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Faerie Fire (1/Day, 1st level spell, concentration)
entries: 60 ft range, 20 ft cube, {@dc 13} DEX save. On a failed save, all attacks have advantage against the target and they can't benefit from invisibility.

variant.name: Note: Moments vs Tactics
entries: Often, the optimal way to play a spellcaster is to spam their strongest spell. In that respect, many of these stat blocks are decidedly un-optimal, since I prioritize casting a greater variety of spells that will make for memorable moments that feel right for the classes. Typically, every time you repeat the same action it becomes less impactful and memorable, so generally I've represented a stat block's highest level spells as 1/day, even when they could do more.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: The Barbarian has advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls, and attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: The Barbarian has advantage on initiative checks, and can act on its turn even if it is surprised.

trait.name: Relentless Rage
entries: When the Barbarian drops to 0 HP, it can make a {@dc 10} CON save. On a success, it drops to 1 HP instead. Each time it uses this feature, the DC increases by 5.

trait.name: Bear Attunement
entries: Hostile creatures within 5 feet of the Barbarian have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Barbarian makes two attacks with its Greataxe. If it reduces a creature to 0 HP with one of these attacks, it may make a third Greataxe attack.

action.name: Greataxe, +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 1d12 + 21}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the Barbarian does 21 additional slashing damage.

trait.name: Fortified Position
entries: The Artificer and its allies within 10 feet have half cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Artifcer attacks once with its Firebolt, and twice with its Force Ballista. It may replace its Firebolt attack with another spell.

action.name: Firebolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Force Ballista
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage and the target is pushed 5 feet back.

action.name: Cone of Cold (1/Day, 5th level spell)
entries: 60 ft cone, {@dc 19} CON save. On a failed save, the target takes 41 ({@damage 9d8}) cold damage, or 1/2 damage on a success.

action.name: Fireball (6/Day, 3rd level spell)
entries: 60 ft range, 20 ft radius sphere, {@dc 18} DEX save. On a failed save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 8d6 + 1d8}) fire damage, or 1/2 damage on a success.

reaction.name: Shield
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the Artificer may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Flash of Genius (5/Day)
entries: As a reaction to seeing an ally within 30 feet make a saving throw, the Artificer can add +5 to it.

reaction.name: Soul of Artifice (6/Day)
entries: As a reaction to dropping to 0 HP, the Artificer may choose to drop to 1 HP instead. The Artificer takes a -1 penalty to saving throws for each time it has used this ability today.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Artifcer attacks once with its Firebolt, and once with its Force Ballista. It may replace its Firebolt attack with another spell.

action.name: Firebolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Force Ballista
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage and the target is pushed 5 feet back.

action.name: Fireball (3/Day, 3rd level spell)
entries: 60 ft range, 20 ft radius sphere, {@dc 17} DEX save. On a failed save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 8d6 + 1d8}) fire damage, or 1/2 damage on a success.

reaction.name: Shield (4/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the Artificer may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Flash of Genius (5/Day)
entries: As a reaction to seeing a friendly creature within 30 feet make a saving throw, the Artificer can add +5 to it.

variant.name: Note: CR
entries: I'm using the offensive abilities of these stat blocks to calculate CR, rather the defensive ones, because PCs are built different from monsters and it's better to err on the side of caution. In a fair fight between evenly matched adventuring parties, the side that rolls higher initiative wins. If your campaign can't handle a TPK, be cautious with using PC-like enemies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Artificer attacks once with its Firebolt, and once with its Force Ballista. It may replace its Firebolt attack with another spell.

action.name: Firebolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Force Ballista
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage and the target is pushed 5 feet back.

action.name: Shatter (1/Day, 2nd level spell)
entries: 60 ft range, 10 ft radius sphere, {@dc 15} CON save. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage, or 1/2 damage on a success.

action.name: Scorching Ray (1/Day, 2nd level spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 10 ft., 3 attacks. Each attack deals {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a hit.

reaction.name: Shield (4/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the Artificer may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

variant.name: Note: Spells as Abilities
entries: I don't think a stat block should ever require you to reference another book/document, so I've chosen to turn all spells into spell-like abilities, at least in presentation. I've included spell levels for all spells of 1st level or higher for the purposes of counterspelling.

A spellcaster will typically not need every one of their spell slots for a 3-6 round combat, so many have fewer here. They also won't need a bunch of RP spells prepared for a combat encounter, which is what stat blocks are for after all. Minute resource tracking is for players. The DM has too much going on to have to worry about that.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If the zombie starts its turn with 0 hit points, it makes a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, unless it took radiant damage or a critical hit since its last turn. On a success, the zombie gains 1 hit point. A zombie with 0 hit points is killed instantly if it is attacked.

trait.name: Sudden Lunge
entries: The zombie's attacks have a threat range of 10 feet for the purposes of making opportunity attacks. When it makes an opportunity attack against a creature more than 5 feet away, it moves 5 feet towards its target as part of the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Spitter makes two slam attacks. It may replace one of its slam attacks with a Predigest.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Predigest {@recharge 5}
entries: The spitter vomits acidic slime in a 20 foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If the zombie starts its turn with 0 hit points, it makes a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, unless it took radiant damage or a critical hit since its last turn. On a success, the zombie gains 1 hit point. A zombie with 0 hit points is killed instantly if it is attacked.

trait.name: Sudden Lunge
entries: The zombie's attacks have a reach of 10 feet for the purposes of making opportunity attacks. When it makes an opportunity attack against a creature more than 5 feet away, it moves 5 feet towards its target as part of the attack.

trait.name: Volatile
entries: If the Burster takes at least 10 points of slashing, piercing or fire damage in a turn, it Erupts. Each creature within 15 feet of it (including it) must succeed at a {@dc 12} Dexterity Saving Throw or suffer {@damage 3d6} poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The burster makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., targets one {@condition grappled} creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If the zombie starts its turn with 0 hit points, it makes a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, unless it took radiant damage or a critical hit since its last turn. On a success, the zombie gains 1 hit point. A zombie with 0 hit points is killed instantly if it is attacked.

trait.name: Sudden Lunge
entries: The zombie's attacks have a reach of 10 feet for the purposes of making opportunity attacks. When it makes an opportunity attack against a creature more than 5 feet away, it moves 5 feet towards its target as part of the attack.

action.name: Slam

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., targets one {@condition grappled} creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Wraith

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Radiance Sensitivity
entries: If the wraith takes radiant damage, it loses its damage resistances and it is temporarily made corporeal until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Weapons
entries: The wraith's attacks treat all creatures as unarmored (an unarmored creature's AC is usually 10 plus its Dexterity modifier.)

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend two of its hit dice. If the creature can't, it instead drops to 0 HP.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

reaction.name: Shadow Glide
entries: As a reaction to taking damage of a type it is resistant to, the Wraith may teleport up to 60 feet and turn {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack. If it does, it can't make attacks on its next turn.

monster.name: Slaughter Wight

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. A wight that takes radiant damage can't use its Soul Harvest on its following turn.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the wight reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the wight can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Death Wail
entries: When the wight dies, each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes three claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. The wight regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or die.

monster.name: Deathlock Wight

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. A wight that takes radiant damage can't use its Soul Harvest on its following turn.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The wight and any undead within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes two grave bolt attacks or two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Grave Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) necrotic damage and the target is afflicted with clinging shadows for the next minute, reducing any sources of bright light within 5 ft. of it to dim light.

action.name: Soul Harvest {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature affected by the wight's grave bolt must make a {@dc 14} Constitution save or be forced to expend two of its hit dice. If the creature can't, it instead drops to 0 HP. The wight gains {@dice 1d8} temporary HP for each hit die expended this way.

action.name: Gravechurn (1/Day)
entries: Up to six humanoid corpses within 30 feet of the wight rise as zombies under the wight's control, and act on its initiative.

monster.name: Wight

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. A wight that takes radiant damage can't use its Life Drain on its following turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one weapon attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend two of its hit dice. If the creature can't, it instead drops to 0 HP.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises on the wight's next turn as a zombie under the wight's control. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Shadow Wisp
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The shadow wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The shadow wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Reactive Illumination
entries: The shadow wisp sheds dim light in a 20-foot radius  while illuminated by no other sources. While illuminated by a source of dim light other than itself, the shadow wisp is {@condition invisible}. While illuminated by a source of bright light other than itself, the wisp shines twice as bright, casting dark shadows.

action.name: Lure
entries: One creature that can see the shadow wisp must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the shadow wisp until the end of the shadow wisp's next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature can do nothing but use its movement to approach the shadow wisp.

action.name: Shadow Betrayal
entries: The shadow wisp incites the shadows of each creature within its illumination to attack the creatures. Each creature within 20 feet of the Wisp must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or take  9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or Long Rest.

monster.name: Will-o'-Wisp
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Consume Life
entries: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Lure
entries: One creature that can see the will-o'-wisp must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the will-o'-wisp until the end of the will-o'-wisp's next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature can do nothing but use its movement to approach the will-o'-wisp.

action.name: Invisibility (Concentration)
entries: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses its Consume Life.

monster.name: Volenta Popofsky
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fed today, has at least 1 hit point, and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

items.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

items.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

items.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is killed.

items.name: Destroyed by Sunlight
entries: A vampire that starts its turn in sunlight may take only the Dash action. A vampire that ends its turn in sunlight is destroyed.

items.name: Blood-Starved
entries: A vampire spawn that has not fed on humanoid blood in the last 24 hours cannot use its multiattack, and does not regenerate.

trait.name: Precision Strike (4/Day)
entries: When the vampire misses an attack roll, it may add a {@dice d10} to the attack roll.

trait.name: Indomitable (1/Day)
entries: When the vampire fails a saving throw, it may reroll it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Hook Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}). On a critical hit, the target drops one item it is holding.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend a hit die.

If the creature expends a hit die in this way, the vampire spawn gains resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from weapons that aren't wooden until the beginning of its next turn. If the creature is unable to, it drops to 0 hit points.

action.name: Action Surge (1/Day)
entries: The vampire immediately takes two additonal actions other than this one. It may take the same action twice.

reaction.name: Riposte (2/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being missed with a melee attack, the Vampire may make melee weaon attack. If it hits, the attack does an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage.

monster.name: Anastrasya Karelova
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fed today, has at least 1 hit point, and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When the vampire makes a Dexterity saving throw, it takes no damage on a success, and half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Cunnning Action
entries: The vampire takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with either its shortbow, shortsword, or bite.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, one creature the vampire has advantage against or that is adjacent to an ally of the vampire's. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, one creature the vampire has advantage against or that is adjacent to an ally of the vampire's. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend a hit die.

If the creature expends a hit die in this way, the vampire spawn gains resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from weapons that aren't wooden until the beginning of its next turn. If the creature is unable to, it drops to 0 hit points.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: As a reaction to being hit with an attack, the vampire reduces the attack's damage by half.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: As a reaction to an enemy ending its movement within 5 ft. of the vampire, the vampire moves up to half its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

monster.name: Ludmilla Vilisevic
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fed today, has at least 1 hit point, and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

items.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

items.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

items.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is killed.

items.name: Destroyed by Sunlight
entries: A vampire that starts its turn in sunlight may take only the Dash action. A vampire that ends its turn in sunlight is destroyed.

items.name: Blood-Starved
entries: A vampire spawn that has not fed on humanoid blood in the last 24 hours cannot use its multiattack, and does not regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend a hit die.

If the creature expends a hit die in this way, the vampire spawn gains resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from weapons that aren't wooden until the beginning of its next turn. If the creature is unable to, it drops to 0 hit points.

action.name: Fireball (1/Day, 3rd level spell)
entries: 120 ft range, 20 ft radius sphere, {@dc 15} DEX save. On a failed save, the target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage, or half damage on a success.

action.name: Hold Person (1/Day, 2nd level spell, concentration)
entries: 60 ft range, 1 target, {@dc 15} WIS save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. One creature has disadvantage on its first save against this spell. The targets repeat the save at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Invisibility (1/Day, 2nd level spell, concentration)
entries: The vampire turns {@condition invisible} for the next hour, or until it casts another spell.

bonus.name: Misty Step (2/Day, 2nd level spell)
entries: The vampire teleports 30 feet to a location it can see.

reaction.name: Shield (4/Day, 1st level spell)
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the vampire may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Counterspell (1/Day, 3rd level spell)
entries: As a reaction to a creature within 60 ft. casting a spell, the vampire attempts to disrupt it. If the spell is 3rd level or below, it fails. If the spell is higher than 3rd level, the vampire must succeed on an Intelligence check with DC equal to 10 plus the spell's level.

monster.name: Vampire Spawn
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Spider Climb

items.name: Blood-Starved

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend a hit die.

If the creature expends a hit die in this way, the vampire spawn gains resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from weapons that aren't wooden until the beginning of its next turn. If the creature is unable to, it drops to 0 hit points.

monster.name: Strahd Van Zarovich
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or back into its true form. While polymorphed, the vampire has a 20 ft. fly speed and can't take actions.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 hit points, it is immune to all damage and can do nothing other than return to its resting place. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. At the next sunset, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

items.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

items.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

items.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is killed.

items.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack. It may replace its bite attack with a use of its Charm ability.

action.name: Exsanguinating Blade
entries: {@hit 9} to hit, {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Then, if the target has 15 HP or fewer it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 HP and fall {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend two hit dice. If the creature is unable to, it drops to 0 hit points. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed.

legendary.name: Leaping Strike
entries: The vampire move up to half its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity and makes an unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Children of the Night
entries: The vampire conjures a swarm of bats or rats in a space of dim light or darkness within 30 feet.

legendary.name: Misty Shroud
entries: The vampire is engulfed in a 20 foot radius cloud of fog that disipates at the end of its next turn. The area is heavily obscured.

legendary.name: Rend Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire ends one spell or magical effect within 60 feet. If the magical effect was produced by an item, the item may not be activated again until the end of the wielder's next turn.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend two hit dice. If the creature is unable to, it drops to 0 hit points. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

legendary.name: Leaping Strike
entries: The vampire move up to half its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity and makes an unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Children of the Night
entries: The vampire conjures a swarm of bats or rats in a space of dim light or darkness within 30 feet.

legendary.name: Rend Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire ends one spell or magical effect within 60 feet. If the magical effect was produced by an item, the item may not be activated again until the end of the wielder's next turn.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Sword Wraith Commander
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Flattery Vulnerability
entries: When subjected to flattery of its martial prowess by a creature, the sword wraith must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the creature until it takes hostile actions against the sword wraith or its allies. A sword wraith that succeeds on this save becomes immune to flattery for the next minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sword wraith makes three weapon attacks and uses its reckless challenge.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Reckless Challenge
entries: One creature within 30 feet must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has advantage on attacks that target the sword wraith, and disadvantage on attacks that target other creatures for the next minute. A creature may fail this save voluntarily.

reaction.name: Call to Honor (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 63 HP, the sword wraith gives itself advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn, and summons {@dice 1d4 + 1} sword wraith warriors that appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. The warriors last until they drop to 0 hit points, and they take their turns immediately after the commander's turn on the same initiative count.

monster.name: Sword Wraith Deathseeker
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Flattery Vulnerability
entries: When subjected to flattery of its martial prowess by a creature, the sword wraith must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the creature until it takes hostile actions against the sword wraith or its allies. A sword wraith that succeeds on this save becomes immune to flattery for the next minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sword wraith makes three weapon attacks and uses its reckless challenge.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Reckless Challenge
entries: One creature within 30 feet must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has advantage on attacks that target the sword wraith, and disadvantage on attacks that target other creatures for the next minute. A creature may fail this save voluntarily.

reaction.name: Empathic Lash
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a magical weapon, the sword wraith may force the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the sword wraith's next turn.

monster.name: Sword Wraith Warrior
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Flattery Vulnerability
entries: When subjected to flattery of its martial prowess by a creature, the sword wraith must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the creature until it takes hostile actions against the sword wraith or its allies. A sword wraith that succeeds on this save becomes immune to flattery for the next minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sword wraith makes two weapon attacks and uses its reckless challenge.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Reckless Challenge
entries: One creature within 30 feet must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has advantage on attacks that target the sword wraith, and disadvantage on attacks that target other creatures for the next minute. A creature may fail this save voluntarily.

variant.name: Variant: Spectral Weapons
entries: The sword wraith's attacks treat all creatures as unarmored (an unarmored creature's AC is usually 10 plus its Dexterity modifier.)

monster.name: Specter
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Radiance Sensitivity
entries: If the specter takes radiant damage, it loses its damage resistances and it is temporarily made corporeal until the beginning of its next turn .

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Weapons
entries: The specter's attacks treat all creatures as unarmored (an unarmored creature's AC is usually 10 plus its Dexterity modifier.)

action.name: Inflict Weakness
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or deal only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength. An affected creature may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Shadow Glide
entries: As a reaction to taking damage of a type it is resistant to, the Specter may teleport up to 60 feet and turn {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack. If it does, it can't make attacks on its next turn.

monster.name: Skeletal Champion
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Unliving Warriors
entries: The skeleton has proficiency in all martial weapons and armor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeletal champion makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shake Bones
entries: One creature within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have its skeleton rattle within its flesh, taking {@dice 4d6} points of bludgeoning damage and moving up to 5 feet in a direction of the skeleton's choice on a failure, or take half damage on a success. An {@condition unconscious} creature that fails this save dies. At the beginning of its next turn, its skeleton tears itself out of the creature's body, acting on the creature's initiative.

reaction.name: Rattle
entries: As a reaction to taking bludgeoning damage from a melee attack, the skeleton forces the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the skeleton until the end of the creature's next turn.

monster.name: Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Unliving Warriors
entries: The skeleton has proficiency in all martial weapons and armor.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Rattle
entries: As a reaction to taking bludgeoning damage from a melee attack, the skeleton forces the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the skeleton until the end of the creature's next turn.

variant.name: Note: Create Undead
entries: A sixth level Create Undead can reasonably be construed to create a Skeletal Champion, as an alternative to the ghoul. The skeleton is more durable and does more damage than the ghoul, but the ghoul's CR is heavily skewed by it's at-will paralysis ability. Also note that the skeleton created by the Shake Bones ability is not placed under the champion's control, unlike the way the similar Wight ability works.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or Darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a Bonus Action.

trait.name: Light Dependance
entries: While in darkness, the shadow is {@condition invisible} and can use its strength drain. While in bright light, the shadow has advantage on attack rolls, but loses its damage resistances.

trait.name: Spectral Weapons
entries: The shadow's attacks treat all creatures as unarmored (an unarmored creature's AC is usually 10 plus its Dexterity modifier.)

action.name: Shadow Choke (Dim or bright light only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) necrotic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} and cannot breathe. If the target was already {@condition grappled}, the target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or lose its held breath and begin to suffocate.

action.name: Strength Drain (Darkness only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

reaction.name: Shadow Glide (Dim light only)
entries: As a reaction to taking damage of a type it is resistant to, the Shadow may teleport up to 60 feet and turn {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack. If it does, it can't make attacks on its next turn.

monster.name: Revenant
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Cursed Resilience
entries: When the revenant is reduced to 0 HP, it does not die or fall {@condition unconscious} immediately. Instead, it loses the ability to use its multiattack and releases all {@condition grappled} creatures, and survives for another {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds before dying. If the revenant takes radiant or fire damage while at 0 HP, it is killed.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a {@spell wish} spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Pronouncement of Guilt
entries: One creature that is {@condition grappled} by the revenant and against which it has sworn vengeance must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. While cursed in this way, its movement speed is halved, it can't teleport, and it has vulnerability to necrotic damage. When a cursed creature takes the dash action, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Annihilating Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a DC21 Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and grant the nightwalker advantage on attack rolls against it until the start of the creature's next turn. Undead are immune to this aura.

trait.name: Light Eater
entries: The area in a 1 mile radius around the nightwalker is illuminated with dim light. Nonmagical sources of bright light are instantly extinguished in this area, as are areas of light created by a spell of 5th level or lower. Celestial bodies appear to be eclipsed.

trait.name: Huge Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the nightwalker may spend half of its movement to attempt a {@dc 14} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the nightwalker. While climbing on the nightwalker, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against the nightwalker.

trait.name: Anti-Life Nature
entries: If the nightwalker would receive magical healing, it instead must succeed a Constitution saving throw against the spellcaster's save DC or take an equal amount of radiant damage. On a success or failure, attacks made against the nightwalker have advantage until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightwalker uses Enervating Focus twice, or it uses Enervating Focus and Finger of Doom, if available.

action.name: Enervating Focus
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC: 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

action.name: Finger of Doom {@recharge 5}
entries: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with a Curse of Doom. While cursed in this way, a creature acquires a Doom counter each time it takes necrotic damage. If the creature drops to 0 hit points while cursed, it immediately fails one Death Save for each Doom counter it has. A creature freed from the curse loses all doom counters.

action.name: Drown in Death
entries: One creature within 120 feet that is in dim light or darkness must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or fall into its shadow. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more cannot hold its breath. While in its shadow, a creature is {@condition blinded}, cannot breathe, and takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature that fails this save while afflicted with a Curse of Doom instead ceases to exist and can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell. A creature may repeat this save as an action, escaping the effect on a success.

monster.name: Mummy Lord
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Warding Curse
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the mummy that hits it with an attack must then make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the mummy's next turn.

trait.name: Final Curse
entries: A creature that reduces the mummy to 0 HP must make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. While cursed, any magical healing the creature receives is reduced by half.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its Plague Chant.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Plague Chant (6th level spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 90 ft., one target. Hit 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage. If this attack hits, the mummy lord uses this ability again, targeting a creature within 15 feet of the previous target. Attacks beyond the first one originate from the previous target, though the mummy lord must use its own senses. A creature can be targeted with this ability only once per turn.

action.name: Grave Terror {@recharge 5}
entries: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom save or suffer 99 ({@damage 18d10}) psychic damage. A creature that isn't {@condition stunned} or {@condition frightened} may use its reaction to move 15 feet directly away from the mummy. If it does, it gains advantage on this saving throw.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The mummy lord makes one attack with its rotting fist or uses its Dreadful Glare.

legendary.name: Blinding Dust
entries: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the mummy lord. Each creature within 5 feet of the mummy lord must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mummy lord utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the mummy lord that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the mummy lord's next turn. A creature that is already {@condition stunned} and fails this save is also {@condition blinded} for the next minute. It may repeat the save at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mummy lord magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the mummy lord, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

legendary.name: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mummy lord magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the mummy lord is immune to all damage, and it can't be {@condition grappled}, {@condition petrified}, knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned}. Equipment worn or carried by the mummy lord remain in its possession.

monster.name: Mummy
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Final Curse
entries: A creature that reduces the mummy to 0 HP must make a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. While cursed, any magical healing the creature receives is reduced by half.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Warding Curse
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the mummy can deal 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage to the creature.

variant.name: Note: Mummy Template
entries: A mummified creature has:
Proficiency* in Wisdom saving throws
Vulnerability* to Fire damage
Resistance* to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing samage from Nonmagical Attacks
Immunity* to Necrotic and Poison damage
Immunity to the following conditions:* {@condition charmed}, {@condition exhaustion}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}
Mummy Rot* It's melee attacks cause Mummy Rot on a failed Constitution saving throw.

monster.name: Baelnorn
languages: Common plus up to five other languages

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the baelnorn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed baelnorn gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The baelnorn is immune to any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Paralyzing Aura
entries: A creature that damages the baelnorn with a melee attack must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the baelnorn's next turn, or until the creature takes damage.

trait.name: Water Walk
entries: The baelnorn can walk on water at will, as if under the effect of the {@spell water walk} spell.

trait.name: Foresight
entries: The baelnorn has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. Attack rolls targeting it have disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The baelnorn attacks three times with its spectral blade.

action.name: Spectral Blade
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. This attack treats the target as unarmored (An unarmored creature's AC is usualy 10 plus its Dexterity modifier).

action.name: Turn The Living
entries: Each living creature within 30 feet must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the baelnorn for the next minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must use its action to dash away from the baelnorn, and repeats this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that passes this save is immune to the baelnorn's Turn The Living ability for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Command Undead
entries: Up to three undead allies of CR 5 or below within 30 feet may each move up to half their speed and take an action.

action.name: Create Wraith {@recharge 5}
entries: The baelnorn targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a wraith under the baelnorn's control in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space.

action.name: Briar Cage
entries: The baelnorn creates a 15 ft radius hemisphere of thorny vines within 60 feet, 1 ft thick. A creature whose space is intersected by the thorns when they appear must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}, moving to a side of its choice on a success. A creature may push through the vines by spending 20 feet of movement and taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) slashing damage. The vines are an object that can be damaged and thus breached. They have AC 21 and 30 hit points, and are vulnerable to fire damage.

action.name: Root
entries: One creature within 90 feet must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or take 30 ({@damage 7d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature may repeat this save as an action, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Dimension Door (4th level spell)
entries: The baelnorn and one willing creature within 5 feet teleport up to 500 ft.

reaction.name: Shield (1st level spell)
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the baelnorn may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Counterspell (3rd level spell)
entries: As a reaction to seeing a creature cast a spell within 60 feet, the baelnorn may make an Intelligence check with DC equal to 10 plus the spell's level, negating the spell on a success. If the spell is 3rd level or below, the baelnron succeeds automatically.

reaction.name: Vanish (1/Day, 4th level spell, concentration.)
entries: As a reaction to a creature reducing it below 50 HP, the baelnorn becomes {@condition invisible} for the next minute.

legendary.name: Spectral Blade
entries: The baelnorn uses its spectral blade.

legendary.name: Zephyr Step
entries: The baelnorn moves up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

legendary.name: Drain Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The baelnorn ends a spell of 3rd level or below affecting a target within 60 feet.

monster.name: Archlich
languages: Common plus up to five other languages

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the archlich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Fated Escape
entries: A destroyed archlich's remains teleport away to the location its essence is hidden. If its essence is undisturbed, a destroyed archlich gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the essence.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The archlich is immune to any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Soporific Aura
entries: A creature that damages the archlich with a melee attack must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or fall asleep until the creature takes damage, or until another creature uses its action to wake it. While sleeping in this way, the creature takes on a deathly palor, and doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink.

action.name: Searing Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Wounding Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Holy Aura (1/Day, 8th level spell, concentration.)
entries: Range self, 30 foot radius. Friendly creatures in the area have advantage on all saving throws, and other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against them until the spell ends.

action.name: Plane Shift (1/Day, 7th level spell.)
entries: The archlich and up to 8 allies within 10 feet teleport to a different plane.

action.name: Harm (1/Day, 6th level spell)
entries: One creature within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) necrotic damage, or half damage on a success. This damage cannot reduce a creature below 1 HP.

action.name: Spirit Guardians (3/Day, 5th level spell, concentration.)
entries: Range self, 15 ft radius. Creatures of the archlich's choice have their speed halved in the area, and must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw when entering the area for the first time on a turn or starting their turn there. On a failed save, an affected creature takes 23 ({@damage 5d8}) radiant damage, half as much on success.

action.name: Dimension Door (3/Day, 4th level spell)
entries: The archlich and one willing creature within 5 feet teleport up to 500 ft.

action.name: Blind
entries: Two creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded}. A {@condition blinded} creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Shield (1st level spell)
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the archlich may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Counterspell (3rd level spell)
entries: As a reaction to seeing a creature cast a spell within 60 feet, the archlich may make an Intelligence check with DC equal to 10 plus the spell's level, negating the spell on a success. If the spell is 3rd level or below, the archlich succeeds automatically.

reaction.name: Healing Eruption (1/Day, 9th level spell.)
entries: As a reaction to a creature reducing it below 50 HP, the archlich restores 700 HP split between any number of creatures within 60 feet.

legendary.name: Searing Ray
entries: The archlich uses its searing ray

legendary.name: Wounding Touch
entries: The archlich uses its wounding touch.

legendary.name: Concussive Step
entries: The archlich teleports 30 feet to a location it can see. Creatures within 5 feet of where it arives must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Drain Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The archlich ends a spell of 3rd level or below affecting a target within 60 feet.

monster.name: Lich
languages: Common plus up to five other languages

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Paralyzing Aura
entries: A creature that damages the lich with a melee attack must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the lich's next turn, or until the creature takes damage.

action.name: Wilting Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Freezing Claw
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Power Word: Stun (1/Day, 8th level spell)
entries: 60 ft range, 1 target. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it is {@condition stunned}. Otherwise, the spell has no effect. At the end of each of its turns, it may make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Finger of Death (2/Day, 7th level spell)
entries: One creature within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 62 ({@damage 7d8 + 30}) necrotic damage, or half damage on a success.

action.name: Disintegrate (1/Day, 6th level spell)
entries: One creature within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 80 ({@damage 10d6 + 45}) force damage, or half damage on a success. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 HP, they are disintegrated.

action.name: Immolation (1/Day, 5th level spell, concentration)
entries: One creature within 90 feet must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 30 ({@damage 7d6 + 5}) fire damage and the creature begins to burn, or half damage on a success. A burning creature repeats this saving throw at the end of their turn, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failure, or ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Dimension Door (3/Day, 4th level spell)
entries: The lich and one willing creature within 5 feet teleport up to 500 ft.

action.name: Fireball (3rd level spell)
entries: 120 ft range, 20 ft radius sphere. Creatures in the area must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage, or half damage on a success.

reaction.name: Shield (1st level spell)
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack, the Lich may add 5 to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Counterspell (3rd level spell)
entries: As a reaction to seeing a creature cast a spell within 60 feet, the lich may make an Intelligence check with DC equal to 10 plus the spell's level, negating the spell on a success. If the spell is 3rd level or below, the lich succeeds automatically.

reaction.name: Murderous Glare (1/Day, 9th level spell.)
entries: As a reaction to a creature reducing it below 50 HP, the lich unleashes a torrent of negative energy at it. If the creature has fewer than 100 HP, it dies.

legendary.name: Wilting Ray
entries: The lich uses its Wilting ray

legendary.name: Freezing Claw
entries: The lich uses its freezing claw.

legendary.name: Shadow Walk
entries: The Lich teleports 30 feet to a location it can see.

legendary.name: Drain Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich ends a spell of 3rd level or below affecting a target within 60 feet.

monster.name: Jiangshi

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't peachwood

languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak them

trait.name: Jiangshi Weaknesses
entries: The jiangshi has the following flaws:

items.name: Breath Sight
entries: A creature that is holding its breath may attempt to hide from the jiangshi without being obsucred.

items.name: Fear of Mirrors
entries: The jiangshi must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn if its sees its reflection.

items.name: Pinned Talisman
entries: If a holy talisman is affixed to the jiangshi's forehead with a successful {@dc 20} Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, the jiangshi must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the seal is removed or it takes damage.

items.name: Flammable
entries: If the jiangshi takes fire damage, it catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the jiangshi takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of the jiangshi's turns, and its attacks deal an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: Hopping Movement
entries: The jiangshi is always facing a single direction, and must spend 5 feet of movement to change its facing. Additionally, it may spend 5 ft. of movement to stand from {@condition prone}. The jiangshi's reach extends only in the direction it is facing.

trait.name: Graceless
entries: If the jiangshi is struck with a melee attack from a direction it is not facing, it is pushed 5 feet away and must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The jiangshi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jiangshi makes three attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claw Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. in the direction it is facing, one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the jiangshi adds one of the following effects:
The target is {@condition grappled}.
The target is pushed 10 ft. away.
