Instead, it loses the ability to take actions other than its Etherealness ability, though it can still communicate. After 24 hours, the banshee recovers all of its HP. While at 0 HP, the banshee can be destroyed any of the following ways:
Resolving its unifinished business.
Subjecting it to the same conditions that killed it.
Performing funeral rites for it with the {@spell Ceremony|XGE} spell.

action.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The banshee enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Wail (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 29 HP, the banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

monster.name: Baigujing

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Flesh of Snow
entries: Whenever the baigujing takes radiant damage, each creature within 5 ft. takes the same amount of radiant damage.

trait.name: Bones of Jade
entries: The baigujing's true form is that of a jade skeleton. She can hide in the shed flesh of other humanoid skeletons, taking on their former voice and appearance.

trait.name: Voice of Two Mouths
entries: When the baigujing speaks, she may say two things at once. The baigujing chooses individually which statement each creature that is not hidden from it hears. A creature hidden from the baigujing hears both statements.

action.name: Draining Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be forced to expend two of its hit dice. If the creature can't, it instead drops to 0 HP.

action.name: Shake Bones {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have its skeleton rattle within its flesh, taking 28 ({@dice 8d6}) points of bludgeoning damage and moving up to 5 feet in a direction of the baigujing's choice on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.
An {@condition unconscious} creature that fails this save dies. At the begining of its next turn, its skeleton tears itself out of the creature's body, acting on its initiative.

reaction.name: Feign Death
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, the baigujing appears to die.

variant.name: Note: Blessed Sustenance
entries: One bite of the flesh of a divine spellcaster will extend the lifespan of the baigujing by a year and a day.

The baigujing seeks to sow discord in a party, to strip her prey of allies and defenses, eat as much as she can, and flee. If she is found out, she will flee or fake her death, then acquire a new disguise and return for another attempt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Festering Presence
entries: If the angel has at least 105 HP, a creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the angel must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be infected with {@disease festering necrosis|ConfC}.

trait.name: Parasitic Presence
entries: If the angel has 105 HP or fewer, it regains 10 hit points at the beginning of its turn for each corpse and each creature within 60 ft. infected with {@disease festering necrosis|ConfC}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two melee attacks, one of which it may replace with its foul unraveling, if available.

action.name: Rotting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. This attack scores a critical on a 16-20 against a creature with fewer than 100 hit points.

action.name: Foul Unraveling {@recharge 5}
entries: The angel lashes out with tendrils of vile corruption, making a rotting touch attack against each creature within 15 ft. On a hit, a creature is dragged up to 10 ft. towards the angel and {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) and {@condition restrained} until the end of the angel's turn.

reaction.name: Wave of Decay
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 105 hit points, the angel unleashes a wave of negative energy. Each creature within 30 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage, or half as much on a success.

monster.name: Allip
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Depths of Madness
entries: A creature that attempts to read the allip's mind has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws for the next minute.

trait.name: Spectral Weapons
entries: The allip's attacks treat all creatures as unarmored (an unarmored creature's AC is usually 10 plus its Dexterity modifier.)

action.name: Maddening Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) psychic damage and the target's Wisdom is reduced by 2 ({@dice 1d4}) until it completes a short or long rest. A creature reduced to 0 Wisdom in this way becomes hostile to all living creatures, including itself, until it recovers.

action.name: Whispers of Madness
entries: Each non-fiend, non-undead creature within 30 ft. must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature uses its reaction to move up to make a melee attack against a living creature in range.

reaction.name: Shadow Glide
entries: As a reaction to taking damage of a type it is resistant to, the allip may teleport up to 60 feet and turn {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack or uses its whispers of madness.

trait.name: Ancestral Memory
entries: The wood woad remembers each wrong and trespass its home forest has ever suffered. It can recognize those who have wronged the forest and their descendants, but has difficulty distinguishing between the two.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on its turn, the wood wad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

trait.name: Nourishing Roots
entries: If the wood woad ends its turn without spending more than half of its movement, it gains 10 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Wooden Body
entries: If the wood woad takes fire damage, it catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the wood woad takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood woad makes two attacks with its cudgel, one of which it may replace with a use of its Nature's Judgement, if available.

action.name: Cudgel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Nature's Judgement (Concentration, Recharge 5-6)
entries: One humanoid creature within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for the next minute. A creature proficient in Nature checks makes this save at advantage.

While {@condition restrained}, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the nearest Fey or Plant creature friendly to the wood woad recovers the same amount of hit points. A creature can repeat this save as an action, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Vegepygmy Fission
entries: When the vegepygmy dies, three vegepygmy scavengers that act on its initiative emerges from the corpse at the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Moldy Fury
entries: Allied vegepygmies within 30 ft. can make a ranged or melee attack each turn as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vegepygmy makes two melee attacks, one of which it may replace with its Mucid Command, if available.

action.name: Livewood Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Mucid Command {@recharge 5}
entries: Each other friendly plant creature within 15 ft. may use its reaction to make a melee attack.

reaction.name: Chest Tendril Lash
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the vegepygmy forces the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 10 ft. away.

reaction.name: Recolonize (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 60 hit points, the vegepygmy releases a cloud of infectious spores. Each non-plant creature within 15 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be infected with {@disease russet mold contagion|ConfC}.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Vegepygmy Fission
entries: When the vegepygmy dies, two vegepygmy scavengers that act on its initiative emerges from the corpse at the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vegepygmy makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Livewood Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rampant Growth
entries: A 10 ft. radius of ground centered on a point within 60 ft. becomes difficult terrain. Non-plant creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Plant creatures in the area regain 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points.

action.name: Lashing Vine (4th level spell, concentration)
entries: The vegepygmy conjures a thorny vine that sprouts from the ground in space within 30 ft. One creature within 30 ft of the vine must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage and be pulled 20 feet directly toward the vine.
The vegepygmy can direct the vine to lash out at the same creature or another one as a bonus action each turn.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Vegepygmy Fission
entries: When the vegepygmy dies, a vegepygmy scavenger that acts on its initiative emerges from the corpse at the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vegepygmy makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Braining Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the beginning of the target's next turn.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Spore Burst
entries: When the vegepygmy dies, it releases a cloud of infectious spores. Each non-plant creature within 5 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be infected with {@disease russet mold contagion|ConfC}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the treant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Huge Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the treant may spend half of its movement to attempt a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the treant. While climbing on the treant, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against the treant, and the treant has disadvantage on melee attacks against it.

trait.name: Wooden Body
entries: If the treant takes fire damage, it catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the treant and all creatures climbing on it take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of the treant's turns, and all attacks against the treant are made at advantage. While on fire, the treant's melee attacks deal an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The treant makes two earthshaking slam attacks, one of which it may replace with a rock or a use of its grasping roots, if availale.

action.name: Earthshaking Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked {@condition prone}. Non-treant creatures within 5 feet of the target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking half the attack's damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grasping Roots {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the treant must succceed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or   take 20 ({@damage 3d12}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} until the end of the treant's next turn (escape {@dc 18}). A creature that was already {@condition prone} makes this save at disadvantage.

reaction.name: Forest Allies
entries: As a reaction to a creature that is within 10 feet of a mundane tree targeting the treant with an attack, the treant may cause the tree to make an earthshaking slam attack against the attacker, using the treant's statistics.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the shambler is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt. The shambler cannot trigger this with its own abilities.

trait.name: Lightning Aura
entries: A creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the shambler takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lightning Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 15 foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 15} dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage, or half as much on a success. A {@condition grappled} creature makes this save at disadvantage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it.

reaction.name: Entangling Hide
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the shambling mound can force the attacker to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boring Roots
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the mound must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw as the shambling mound attempts to bore roots through its flesh. On a failed save, the creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage, and its HP maximum is reduced by the same amount.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

reaction.name: Entangling Hide
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the shambling mound can force the attacker to make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Innocent Heart
entries: Walter's infant corpse lies at the center of the flesh mound, crying and afraid. Walter is part of the flesh mound, but has the following properties:
A creature with at least 15 Passive Perception, or a creature engulfed by the flesh mound, can discern his location.
Attacks against Walter are made at disadvantage.
Attacks against Walter deal double damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boring Tendrils
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the mound must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw as the shambling mound attempts to bore roots through its flesh. On a failed save, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, and its HP maximum is reduced by the same amount.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

reaction.name: Grasping Hide
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the flesh mound can force the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Poor Turner
entries: The plague brush must move at least 10 feet in a straight line before turning, unless it hits a solid surface. It cannot make turns sharper than 45 degrees.

trait.name: Mostly Air
entries: Any critical hit agains the plague brush becomes a normal hit. A natural roll of 1-7 always misses the plague brush.

trait.name: Woody Body
entries: If the plague brush takes fire damage, it catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the plague brush and all creatures {@condition grappled} by it take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of the plague brush's turns. Whenever the plague brush takes fire damage, each creature {@condition grappled} by it may use its reaction to attempt to escape.

trait.name: Scoop
entries: The plague brush may move through the space of any Huge or smaller creature or object. A creature whose space the plague brush moves through must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}) and {@condition restrained}. Unsecured objects are {@condition grappled} automatically.

action.name: Shed Spores
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the plague brush must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is infected with {@disease greensickness|ConfC}.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the fungus takes damage, all other plant creatures within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fungus makes {@dice 1d4} Rotting Touch attacks.

action.name: Rotting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 8} Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with {@disease ophidomycosis|ConfC}.

trait.name: Host-Seeking
entries: Each time a living creature within 60 feet takes an action, the Spore Globe may move 5 feet towards it.

trait.name: Toxic
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a Spore Cluster must make a {@dc 10} Constitution Saving Throw or suffer {@damage 1d6} poison damage. If this save is failed by more than 5, the creature is also infected with {@disease ophidomycosis|ConfC}.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the Spore Globe is reduced to 0 HP, it explodes. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If this save is failed by more than 5, the creature is also infected with {@disease ophidomycosis|ConfC}.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Sovereign Spores
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more myconid sovreigns must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature can't take hostile actions or reactions, and its movement speed is halved.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 3d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage. This attack is made with advantage if it targets a {@condition poisoned} creature.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Animating Spores
entries: The myconid targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. At the beginning of the myconid's next turn, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for {@dice 1d4 + 1} weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the one or more myconid adults must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature can't take hostile actions or reactions.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage. This attack is made with advantage if it targets a {@condition poisoned} creature.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Molifying Spores
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more myconid sprouts must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become indifferent to each of them until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) bludgeoning damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage. This attack is made with advantage if it targets a {@condition poisoned} creature.

action.name: Rapport Spores (3/Day)
entries: A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

trait.name: Huge Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the gulthias tree may spend half of its movement to attempt a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the treant. While climbing on the gulthias tree, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against the it.

trait.name: Wooden Body
entries: If the gulthias tree takes fire damage, it catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the gulthias tree and all creatures climbing on it take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of the treant's turns, and all attacks against the gulthias tree are made at advantage. While on fire, the gulthias tree's melee attacks deal an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gulthias tree makes two attacks with its earthshaking slam, one of which it may replace with a use of its Vile Birth or Grasping Roots, if availale.

action.name: Earthshaking Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked {@condition prone}. Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking half the attack's damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failed save.

action.name: Vile Birth
entries: The Gulthias Tree spawns 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) Twig Blights that appear within 5 ft. of it.

action.name: Grasping Roots {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the treant must succceed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or   take 20 ({@damage 3d12}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} until the end of the gulthias tree's next turn (escape {@dc 18}). A creature that was already {@condition prone} makes this save at disadvantage.

legendary.name: Stakes From The Earth
entries: Wooden stakes rise from the earth in two 5-ft. radius areas. The areas become difficult terrain, and when a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

legendary.name: Frightful Keening
entries: Blood oozes from the gulthias tree as it releases a low keening moan. Each creature of the tree's choice in a 120 ft. radius must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the gulthias tree's next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more ages {@dice 1d20} years.

legendary.name: Blood Drain (costs 2 actions)
entries: Black tendrils worm out of the tree's roots, piercing into flesh. Each creature that is {@condition prone} and within 50 ft. of the tree must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and be forced to expend two of its hit dice. If the creature can't, it instead drops to 0 HP. The Tree gains 5 temporary hit points for each hit die expended this way. A creature that dies this way rises the next day as a vampire spawn.

trait.name: Greater Spore Host
entries: {@dice 1d4} Rounds after it is killed, the behemoth's body releases {@dice 1d12} Spore Globes.

trait.name: Creature of the Dark
entries: Attacks that deal Fire or Radiant damage are made at advantage against the behemoth.

trait.name: Huge Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the behemoth may spend half of its movement to attempt a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the behemoth. While climbing on the behemoth, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against the behemoth, and the behemoth has disadvantage on melee attacks against it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Behemoth uses its spore breath and makes two Slam Attacks. It may replace one of its slam attacks with an Engulf.

action.name: Spore Breath
entries: Each creature in a 30 ft. cone must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution Saving Throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and be afflicted with {@disease ophidomycosis|ConfC}, or take half damage on success.

action.name: Slam
entries: Each creature in a 5 ft. radius centered on a point within 15 ft. must succeed on a  {@dc 18} Dexterity Saving Throw or take 19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} creature hit with this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). A creature that succeeds may use its reaction to move out of the area. Otherwise, they take half damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The Behemoth engulfs a Medium or smaller creature that is {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the Behemoth's turns or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, or half as muich on a success. If the Behemoth moves, the engulfed target moves with it.

legendary.name: Roil
entries: A tidal wave of mycellia spill out from the Behemoth. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away and take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage. The affected area becomes difficult terrain.

legendary.name: Burgeoning
entries: The Behemoth rapidly buds and splits off {@dice 1d8} Spore Globes. They may immediately move up to 10 feet.

legendary.name: Blue Dreaming (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Behemoth lowers itself and a cavernous maw tears open in its front. Each creature infected with {@disease ophidomycosis|ConfC} must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or use its following turn to climb into the behemoth, becoming subject to its Engulf ability. The behemoth's Mycelia core revealed, granting attacks against it advantage until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Corpses
entries: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of {@dice 1d6 + 3} humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine dead humanoids. At the beginning of each of its turns, the corpse flower gains temporary hit points equal to the number of corpses it contains.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stench of Death
entries: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or of a zombie under its control must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the beginning of its next turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature's movement speed is halved and attacks against the creature are made at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corpse flower makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Harvest
entries: The corpse flower stuffs a {@condition grappled} creature into itself. A living creature in the corpse flower is {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 16}), and takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage at the beginning of each of the corpse flower's turns. Corpses in the corpse flower can be used with its corpses trait.

reaction.name: Disgorge Zombie
entries: As a reaction to taking damage of a type that isn't fire or radiant, the corpse flower disgorges one of its corpses, which rises immediately as a zombie under the corpse flower's control in an unoccupied space within 10 ft., and acts on initiative count 0.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead shrub.

trait.name: Rooted
entries: The blight makes saves and ability checks to resist being forced to move or be knocked {@condition prone} at advantage. If the blight is forced to move or knocked {@condition prone}, it loses 9 ({@dice 2d8}) hit points.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and a Large or smaller target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) . Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the blight can't constrict another target.

action.name: Entangling Plants {@recharge 5}
entries: Grasping roots and vines sprout in a 15-foot radius centered on the blight, withering away after 1 minute. For the duration, that area is difficult terrain for nonplant creatures. In addition, each creature of the blight's choice in that area when the plants appear must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 12} Strength check, freeing it self or another entangled creature within reach on a success.

reaction.name: Alarm Pollen
entries: As a reaction to taking fire damage, the blight may release a pollen that agitates plant creatures within 30 feet, giving them advantage on their next attack roll made in the next minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead shrub.

trait.name: Rooted
entries: The blight makes saves and ability checks to resist being forced to move or be knocked {@condition prone} at advantage. If the blight is forced to move or knocked {@condition prone}, it loses 4 ({@dice 1d8}) hit points.

trait.name: Prickly
entries: A creature that hits the needle blight with a melee attack takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Needles
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage and the target has its speed reduced by 5 until it takes an action to remove the needles.

reaction.name: Alarm Pollen
entries: As a reaction to taking fire damage, the blight may release a pollen that agitates plant creatures within 30 feet, giving them advantage on their next attack roll made in the next minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead shrub.

trait.name: Rooted
entries: The blight makes saves and ability checks to resist being forced to move or be knocked {@condition prone} at advantage. If the blight is forced to move or knocked {@condition prone}, it loses 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Splinter
entries: If the blight takes bludgeoning damage, each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Alraune remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a large flower.

trait.name: Loam Scent
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the Alraune must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can do nothing but use its movement to safely approach the Alraune. While within 5 feet of the Alraune, the creature uses its action to begin digging itself a shallow grave, or climbs into an open grave and lies {@condition prone}. A creature repeats this save whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on a success. A creature that passes this save is immune to the alraune's Loam Scent for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If the alraune takes fire damage, it catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the alraune takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of the its turns. While on fire, the alraune's melee attacks deal an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alraune makes four vine lash attacks, one of which it may replace with a use of its Dig Grave or Draining Tomb if its Enticing Lure is active.

action.name: Vine Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Dig Grave
entries: The alraune magically excavates a 10 ft. deep, 5 ft. wide column of earth within 10 ft. of it. A creature standing in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature may climb out as an action with a successful {@dc 12} Strength (Athletics) check.

action.name: Draining Tomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The alraune fills in a grave within 10 ft. of it, burying any creatures within. A buried creature cannot speak or breathe, and takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns if the Alraune is within 30 ft., as the alraune's roots drain its blood.

bonus.name: Enticing Lure
entries: The alraune produces an outgrowth that appears within 5 feet of its central flower, appearing as a humanoid creature. For all purposes the alraune is the outgrowth and occupies its space. The outgrowth is tethered to the main body by vines that spread along the ground and extend up to 30 feet. The Alraune can have only a single outgrowth active at a time, and can destroy its outgrowth as a bonus action.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Oblex can move through a space as small as 1 inch without squeezing or slowing down.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on the next attack it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oblex makes two pseudopod attacks and uses its eat memories ability. It may replace its eat memories with either its synaptic feedback ability or its insightful manipulation ability.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Eat Memories
entries: The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest. While memory drained, the target does not add its proficiency bonus to attack rolls or saving throws and cannot cast spells of the highest level it knows. When an oblex causes a target to become memory drained, the oblex learns all the languages the target knows and gains all its proficiencies, except any saving throw proficiencies.

action.name: Synaptic Feedback (2nd level spell, concentration)
entries: One memory drained creature within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed}. At the end of its turn, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Insightful Manipulation (5th level spell, concentration)
entries: One creature within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} and under the oblex's control. At the end of its turn, and whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. A memory drained creature makes this save at disadvantage.

action.name: Dimension Door
entries: The oblex teleports up to 500 feet away, along with all of its outgrowths.

bonus.name: Sulphureous Impersonation
entries: The oblex may reduce its max HP by 10 and produces an outgrowth with 10 HP that appears at any point within 15 feet of it or one of its outgrowths, copying the appearance and manner of any being it has eaten the memories of. Damage dealt to the outgrowths is not dealt to the main oblex body, but for all other purposes the oblex is the outgrowths and occupies their space. The outgrowths are tethered to the main body by a thin strand of translucent slime that can extend up to 500 feet away.

reaction.name: Secret Mouth
entries: When a creature misses an outgrowth of the oblex with a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a pseudopod attack against the attacker.

variant.name: Note: Oblex Tactics
entries: The Oblex is a man-behind-the-curtain sort of mastermind. If your players didn't seek it out, the main body should never even be present and available for them to attack. If its main body is ever found, its first and only priority should be escaping with dimension door while plopping out clones to distract the party.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Oblex can move through a space as small as 1 inch without squeezing or slowing down.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on the next attack it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oblex makes one pseudopod attack and uses its eat memories ability. It may replace its eat memories with either its synaptic feedback ability or its insightful manipulation ability.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Eat Memories
entries: The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest. While memory drained, the target does not add its proficiency bonus to attack rolls and cannot cast spells of the highest level it knows. When an oblex causes a target to become memory drained, the oblex learns all the languages the target knows and gains all its proficiencies, except any saving throw proficiencies.

The outgrowths are tethered to the main body by a thin strand of translucent slime that can extend up to 500 feet away.

entries: When a creature misses an outgrowth of the oblex with a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a pseudopod attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Oblex can move through a space as small as 1 inch without squeezing or slowing down.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on the next attack it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Secret Mouth

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 13}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic makes two pseudopod attacks, one of which it may replace with its bite or lunge, if available.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Lunge {@recharge 5}
entries: The mimic launches itself into a medium or smaller creature within 20 feet. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition grappled} in the mimic's space. While {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature is {@condition blinded}, cannot breathe or speak, and takes 9 ({@dice 2d8}) acid damge at the start of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Blinding Spray
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 29 hit points, the mimic launches a spray of blinding acid in a 20 foot radius around itself. Creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} acid damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. A creature may gain advantage on this save by using its reaction to avert its gaze. Then, the mimic may use its Shapechanger trait as part of this reaction.

monster.name: Gelatinous Symbiote Shadow Wisp
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The symbiote can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The symbiote can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Reactive Illumination
entries: The symbiote sheds dim light in a 20-foot radius  while illuminated by no other sources. While illuminated by a source of dim light other than itself, the symbiote is {@condition invisible}. While illuminated by a source of bright light other than itself, the wisp shines twice as bright, casting dark shadows.

trait.name: Ooze Swimmer
entries: The symbiote is not {@condition restrained} while engulfed.

trait.name: Protective Cube
entries: The symbiote has full cover from ranged attacks made from outside the cube. Melee attacks against the symbiote from outside the cube are made at disadvantage. Likewise, creatures outside the cube have full cover against ranged attacks made by the symbiote, and the symbiote makes melee attacks against creatures outside the cube at disadvantage.

action.name: Lure
entries: One creature that can see the symbiote must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the symbiote until the end of the symbiote's next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature can do nothing but use its movement to approach the symbiote.

action.name: Shadow Betrayal
entries: The symbiote incites the shadows of each creature within its illumination to attack the creatures. Each creature within 20 feet of the Wisp must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or take  9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or Long Rest.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.
Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage.
The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack (Huge size only)
entries: The pudding makes two pseudopod attacks, one of which it may replace with its Predigest, if available.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

action.name: Engulf (Huge size only)
entries: The pudding attempts to drag up to two medium or smaller creatures within 5 ft. into its space. Each must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be dragged into the pudding's space and {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, a creature is {@condition blinded} and takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) acid damage at the start of each of the pudding's turns. If the pudding splits, all {@condition grappled} creatures are freed from it.

action.name: Predigest {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature within 15 ft. must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) acid damage and for the next minute does not reset failed death saves when it gains hit points or becomes stable. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

reaction.name: Adapt
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, the black pudding adds that damage type to the set of damage types that trigger its split ability for the next minute.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to fire, lightning, slashing, or piercing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.
Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage.
The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

trait.name: Battle-Honed Reflexes
entries: The veteran adds its Wisdom modifier to initiative rolls. At initiative count 20 on the first round of combat it may move up to half its speed and take the dodge action or drop {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Advantageous Position
entries: The veteran's attacks are made at advantage if it is in cover or an elevated position, as long as it is not flanked.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks, or makes one crossbow attack and takes the Dash or Disengage action.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Pommel Bash
entries: As a reaction to being missed with a melee attack, the veteran may attempt a contested Strength (Athletics) check to shove the attacker {@condition prone} or push it 5 ft. away.

trait.name: Hireling
entries: The thug is often willing to accept a bribe rather than fight. A group of thugs will usually accept a rate of 10 gp per thug, though it may accept less.

trait.name: Ruffian's Code
entries: Unless it has a compelling reason to do otherwise, the thug makes melee attacks nonlethally.

trait.name: Dirty Fighting
entries: Whenevever the thug makes a successful grapple or shove attempt, it may make a melee attack at advantage as a bonus action this turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thug makes two melee attacks, either of which it may replace with a shove or grapple attempt.

action.name: Blackjack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the target is knocked {@condition prone} and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the thug's next turn.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Beat Down
entries: As a reaction to a creature standing from {@condition prone} within 5 ft. of the thug, the thug may make a melee attack against it. If the attack hits, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} again.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow

trait.name: Impostor
entries: The spy has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to pass itself off as a different person. It adds its deception bonus to initiative rolls.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spy can use a Bonus Action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spy attacks twice with its shortsword and uses its Sabotage, if available.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage On a critical hit, the target must suceed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding.

action.name: Sabotage {@recharge 5}
entries: The spy attempts a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) roll against the Passive Perception of a creature within 5 ft. that is wielding a crossbow, firearm, or spell focus. On a success, the next attack the creature makes with that crossbow, firearm or spell focus backfires, targeting the creature.

reaction.name: Fake Out (3/Day)
entries: As a reaction to missing with an attack, the spy adds its Deception bonus to the attack roll. If this bonus causes the attack to beat the target's AC by 5 or more, the attack scores a critical.

reaction.name: Feign Death
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, the spy appears to die, collapsing and slowing its heart rate. A creature may detect that it is still alive with a successful {@dc 19} Wisdom (Medicine) check.

trait.name: Impostor
entries: The spy has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to pass itself off as a different person. It adds its deception bonus to initiative rolls.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Shortsword

reaction.name: Fake Out (2/Day)
entries: As a reaction to missing with an attack, the spy adds its Deception bonus to the attack roll.

trait.name: Pirate's Panache
entries: If the pirate makes a successful {@dc 15} Athletics or Acrobatics check as part of its movement, its gains Panache until the end of its turn. While the pirate has panache, it makes attacks at advantage and a creature it hits with an attack is pushed 5 ft. away.

trait.name: Bravado
entries: While the pirate is not {@condition incapacitated}, it always appears to succeed on saving throws, even when it fails.

trait.name: Fearsome Reputation
entries: The pirate's reputation for mercy to those who surrender and ruthlessness to those who resist is known to any creature with proficiency in History.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes three attacks with its cutlass. Then, if the pirate has Panache, it may use its Inspiring Advance ability.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop one item is is holding.

action.name: Brace of Flintlocks
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage. The pirate has four pistols that each contain one shot and can be reloaded on a short or long rest.

action.name: Inspiring Advance
entries: Each friendly pirate within 30 ft. increases its movement speed by 10 ft. and has advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks until the beginning of the captain's next turn.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: As a reaction to being missed with a melee attack, the pirate makes a melee attack against the attacker.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes two attacks with its cutlass. Then, if the pirate has Panache, it may use its Split the Shares ability.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. The pirate has four pistols that each contain one shot and can be reloaded on a short or long rest.

action.name: Split the Shares
entries: Each friendly pirate within 30 ft. that has fewer than half it's maximum hit points gains 10 temporary hit points.

reaction.name: Belay That!
entries: As a reaction to a creature within 30 ft. making an attack, the pirate causes the creature to reroll the attack, taking the second result.

trait.name: Gunner's Savvy
entries: Cannons and deck guns operated by a gunner may target specific areas of a ship, allowing attacks to cripple a ship without sinking it.

action.name: Aim!
entries: The pirate gains Panache if it did not have it, and does not lose Panache at the end of this turn. While the pirate has Panache, each friendly creature within 30 ft. can use the pirate's attack bonus for ranged weapon attacks, rather than its own.

action.name: Fire!
entries: Up to two friendly creatures within 30 ft. may use their reaction to make a ranged weapon attack. If the pirate has Panache, it may instead target up to four friendly creatures.

trait.name: Pirate's Panache
entries: If the pirate makes a successful {@dc 15} Athletics or Acrobatics check as part of its movement, its gains Panache until the end of its turn. While the pirate has panache, it makes attacks at advantage and a creature it hits with an attack is pushed 5 ft. away.

trait.name: Musiker's Dance
entries: If the musiker has panache, it may Dodge as a Bonus Action.

action.name: Battleshanty
entries: One friendly creature within 60 ft. may move up to half its speed and make an attack. If the pirate has Panache, the target may instead move its full speed and take an Action.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or drop one item is is holding.

reaction.name: Dancing Lead
entries: As a reaction to being missed with a melee attack, the pirate causes the attacker to move up to 5 ft. and reroll the attack against another target in range of the pirate's choice.

trait.name: Brute Strength
entries: The pirate may attempt to Shove a creature as a bonus action. If the pirate has Panache, a creature successfully shoved by it is both pushed 5 ft. away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Silver Tongue
entries: The noble has advantage on Charisma based ability checks to interact with guards or other figures of authority.

trait.name: Ransom
entries: A captured noble can be ransomed to its family or patron, typically for a sum between 1,000 gp and 30,000 gp, depending on the noble's wealth and social standing.

trait.name: Duelist's Eye
entries: The noble can make two reactions each round, as long as it is not flanked. It may not make more than one reaction in response to a single trigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The noble makes two attacks with its rapier.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the target must suceed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Bon Mot
entries: As a reaction to being missed with a melee attack, the noble makes a cutting remark. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls that target the noble until the end of the attacker's next turn.

trait.name: Ransom

reaction.name: Bon Mot

trait.name: Graveway Traveler
entries: Once on its turn, the necromancer can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into an area of loose earth within its reach and emerge from any area of loose earth within 60 feet, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second space. Both areas must be Large or larger.

trait.name: Dread Revels
entries: The necromancer has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Ghostly Chill
entries: The first time each turn that a wraith or specter passes through a living creature within 60 ft., the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Clinging Spirit (Mythic Trait, 1/day)
entries: When the necromancer is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, it gains 175 temporary hit points, and gains resistance to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Silvered for the next minute.

trait.name: Reclaim Anima (3/Day)
entries: If the necromancer fails a saving throw, it can drain the animating force from one undead creature it controls to succeed instead, reducing the creature to 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer uses its Grave Bolt four times.

action.name: Grave Bolt (2nd level spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) necrotic damage and the target is afflicted with clinging shadows for the next minute, reducing any sources of bright light within 5 ft. of it to dim light.

action.name: Wrench Heart (7th level spell, concentration)
entries: One creature within 60 feet that the necromancer can see feels a spectral hand sink into its chest and grip its heart. At the begining of each of the creature's turns it takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Ghastly Scourge (6th level spell, Recharge 5-6)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}93 ({@damage 6d10 + 60}) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it immediately fails one death save.

reaction.name: Necromiasma (2nd level spell)
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 30 ft. fails a Constitution save by 5 or more, the necromancer corrupts the wound. The creature is unnafected by the first source of healing it receives before the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Heartstop (8th level spell, 1/day)
entries: As a reaction to a creature reducing it below 88 hit points, the necromancer attempts to crush the creature's heart within its chest. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or die. A creature with no unexpended hit dice makes this save at disadvantage.

legendary.name: Scent of the Living
entries: Up to two undead within 30 ft. of the necromancer may each move up to 20 ft. toward the nearest hostile creature to them.

legendary.name: Lay Bare
entries: One creature the necromancer can see within 60 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

legendary.name: Bind Wraith (3/Day, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One humanoid creature that died in the last minute rises as a wraith under the necromancer's control that acts on the necromancer's initiative.

trait.name: Graveway Traveler
entries: Once on its turn, the necromancer can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into an area of loose earth within its reach and emerge from any area of loose earth within 60 feet, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second space. Both areas must be Large or larger.

trait.name: Eternal Tide
entries: At the begining of the necromancer's turn, one ghoul or ghast that died in the last turn returns to undeath with 1 hit point and acts on the necromancer's initiative, rather than its own.

trait.name: Dread Revels
entries: The necromancer has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Reclaim Anima (3/Day)
entries: If the necromancer fails a saving throw, it can drain the animating force from one undead creature it controls to succeed instead, reducing the creature to 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer uses its Grave Bolt twice.

action.name: Grave Bolt (2nd level spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) necrotic damage and the target is afflicted with clinging shadows for the next minute, reducing any sources of bright light within 5 ft. of it to dim light.

action.name: Wrench Heart (4th level spell, concentration)
entries: One creature within 60 feet that the necromancer can see feels a spectral hand sink into its chest and grip its heart. At the begining of each of the creature's turns for the next minute it takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the beginning of its next turn, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Filth Harvest (6th level spell, Recharge 5-6)
entries: One creature that is {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, or infected with {@disease ghoul fever|ConfC} must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage and the necromancer gains temporary hit points equal to the half the damage dealt.

reaction.name: Necromiasma (2nd level spell)
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 30 ft. fails a Constitution save by 5 or more, the necromancer corrupts the wound. The creature is unnafected by the first source of healing it receives before the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Death Throes
entries: As a reaction when a ghoul or ghast within 30 ft. is reduced to 0 hit points, the necromancer allows it to make a single attack with its reaction before dying.

legendary.name: Scent of the Living
entries: Up to two undead within 30 ft. of the necromancer may each move up to 20 ft. toward the nearest hostile creature to them.

legendary.name: Awaken the Hunger
entries: One living creature afflicted with {@disease ghoul fever|ConfC} must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target uses its reaction to drop what its holding, move up to half its speed toward the nearest humanoid creature and make an unarmed attack against it.

legendary.name: Churn the Graves (3/Day, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One humanoid creature that died in the last minute rises as a ghoul under the necromancer's control that acts on the necromancer's initiative.

trait.name: Graveway Traveler
entries: Once on its turn, the necromancer can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into an area of loose earth within its reach and emerge from any area of loose earth within 60 feet, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second space. Both areas must be Large or larger.

trait.name: Rot Shepherd
entries: Friendly zombies within 30 ft. of the necromancer may attempt to Grapple or Shove a creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: Dread Revels
entries: The necromancer has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Reclaim Anima (3/Day)
entries: If the necromancer fails a saving throw, it can drain the animating force from one undead creature it controls to succeed instead, reducing the creature to 0 hit points.

action.name: Grasping Grave (3rd level spell)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Panickfog (4th level spell, Concentration, Recharge 5-6)
entries: A dense fog descends in a 30 ft. radius around the necromancer, heavily obscuring the area for the next minute. A creature that starts its turn in the fog, or enters it for the first time on a turn, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the necromancer's next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more uses all of its remaining movement to move in a random direction.

reaction.name: Corpus Potency (1st level spell)
entries: As a reaction to the necromancer or a friendly zombie within 30 ft. making a Constitution saving throw, the necromancer grants the target advantage on the save. If the saving throw was against a damaging effect, the target takes no damage on a successful save.

reaction.name: Reanimate (5th level spell, 1/day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 95 hit points, the necromancer animates up to six humanoid corpses that rise on its turn as Zombies with 1 hit point  and act on the necromancer's initiative and under the its control for the next minute.

legendary.name: Scent of the Living
entries: Up to two undead within 30 ft. of the necromancer may each move up to 15 ft. toward the nearest hostile creature to them.

legendary.name: Drag to Earth
entries: One zombie within 30 ft. of the necromancer may attempt to shove a creature within range.

legendary.name: The Graveless Dead (3/Day, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The necromancer chooses an unoccupied space within 30 ft. At the begining of the necromancer's following turn, a zombie under the necromancer's control that acts on the necromancer's initiative unearths itself in that space.

trait.name: Graveway Traveler
entries: Once on its turn, the necromancer can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into an area of loose earth within its reach and emerge from any area of loose earth within 60 feet, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second space. Both areas must be Large or larger.

trait.name: Ossuary Call
entries: Friendly skeletons within 30 ft. of the necromancer may use its attack bonus in place of their own.

trait.name: Dread Revels
entries: The necromancer has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Clutch of Terror (3rd level spell)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and the target is dragged 10 feet toward the necromancer, then must  succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for the next minute. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Corrupt Marrow (4th level spell, Recharge 5-6)
entries: Each creature in a 15 ft. radius centered on a point within 60 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necroctic damage. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the necromancer's next turn.

reaction.name: Shield of Bones (2nd level spell)
entries: As a reaction to the necromancer or a friendly skeleton being targeted with an attack, the necromancer raises a shield of bones and earth, adding 5 to the target's AC until the beginning of the necromancer's next turn.

reaction.name: To Dust (3rd level spell, 1/day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 68 hit points, the necromancer causes any number of skeletons or skeletal corpses to explode in a cloud of shrapnel and choking dust. Each creature within 10 ft. of one or more exploding skeletons must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and be unable to speak or breathe until the end of the necromancer's next turn.

trait.name: Ransom
entries: A captured knight can be ransomed to its family or patron, typically for a sum between 50 gp and 1,000 gp, depending on the knight's wealth and social standing.

trait.name: Inspiring Stand
entries: Whenever the knight passes a saving throw, each other creature that made a saving throw against the same effect may reroll its result, taking the higher of the two.

trait.name: Cavalier
entries: While riding a warhorse or similar beast, the knight acts on its mount's initiative, rather than rolling its own, and it has advantage on attack rolls against creatures smaller than its mount.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is mounted, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target must suceed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: The knight adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. If this causes the attack to miss, the knight may make a greatsword attack as part of this reaction.

trait.name: Ransom
entries: A captured knight can be ransomed to its family or patron, typically for a sum between 50 gp and 1,000 gp, depending on the knight's wealth and social standing.

trait.name: Honorable Fealty
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} while its liege lord can see it.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding its sword.

trait.name: Strike to Subdue
entries: The guard's attacks are nonlethal.

trait.name: Rapid Assessment
entries: The guard rolls initiative at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three attacks with its poleaxe, one of which it may replace with a stunning slam, if available.

action.name: Poleaxe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. This attack deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage if made with advantage.

action.name: Stunning Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature within 10 feet must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the guard's next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Authoritative Command
entries: The guard speaks a command of up to three words to a creature within 30 feet. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, it can't take actions other than to dash or to follow the command.

entries: The guard's attacks are nonlethal.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Truncheon
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Voice of Command
entries: The guard speaks a command of up to three words. Each creature of the guard's choice within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, it can't take actions other than to dash or to follow the command.

action.name: Whistle
entries: The guard produces a series of loud coded whistles that communicate basic details to all friendly guards within 500 feet.

trait.name: Muffling Grapple
entries: A creature {@condition grappled} by the guard cannot perform the somatic components of spells.
