action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Slippery
entries: If an attack misses the goblin, it can move up to 5 feet as a reaction without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Insatiable Hunger
entries: When the gnoll makes a bite attack against a dead or {@condition unconscious} creature, it gains 5 temporary HP. When the gnoll makes a bite attack against a living gnoll, it gains 10 temporary HP.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gnoll hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Frenzied Presence
entries: Gnolls within 30 feet of the Pack Lord add {@dice 1d4} to their attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its cudgel. It may replace its bite attack with a use of its Pack Cackle ability.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spined Halberd

action.name: Cudgel of Bloody Teeth

action.name: Howl to the Lord of Ruin {@recharge 5}

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the target begins to bleed for the next minute. A bleeding creature does not stabilize after rolling three successful death saves.

action.name: Blood Call {@recharge 5}
entries: Each bleeding creature in a 30 foot radius must make a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and be dragged 15 feet toward the gnoll.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the githzerai is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Psionic Empowerment
entries: As a bonus action, the githzerai gains one of the following benefits until the beginning of its next turn.

items.name: Telekinetic Extension
entries: The githzerai's melee attacks have a range of 30 ft.

items.name: Immunity
entries: The githzerai can't be affected by spells of 5th level or below, and has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

items.name: Forcefield
entries: The githzerai gains +5 AC.

items.name: Augmented Strikes
entries: Whenever the githzerai hits a creature with an attack, it does an additonal 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage and pushes the creature 5 ft. away.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The githzerai makes three unarmed strikes.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Plane Shift (1/Day)
entries: The githzerai and up to 8 willing adjacent creatures teleport to a location it is familiar with on this or another plane of existence.

reaction.name: Iron Mind
entries: As a reaction to failing an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, the githzerai rerolls the save with advantage.

reaction.name: Gravity Storm
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 122 hit points, the githzerai uses its Reorient Gravity against any number of creatures within range.

legendary.name: Tame Chaos
entries: The githzerai targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. The next attack made against that creature in the next minute is made at advantage. If it hits, it is a critical hit.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The githzerai teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it.

legendary.name: Reorient Gravity
entries: One creature the githzerai can see within 60 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 40 ft. in a direction of the githzerai's choice. A creature pushed into a wall or other solid object takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Psionic Strobe

items.name: Forcefield

trait.name: Honourable Fealty
entries: While the giff is within 60 feet of a giff of higher CR, it may reroll up to two damage dice on each of its turns. If it does so, it must use the new roll.

trait.name: Null Hide
entries: The giff has resistance to damage from spells of third level or below. It cannot use or be targeted by magic items.

trait.name: Danger Close
entries: The Giff lives for the music of battle. It has resistance to damage from magical or nonmagical effects that affect a sphere or cube. If the giff fails a saving throw against such an effect, its next attack is made at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Giff uses its Impact Grenade twice. It may replace one of these with a use of its Juggernaut Charge.

action.name: Impact Grenade
entries: The giff throws a grenade up to 60 feet. Each creature within 15 feet of the grenade's detonation must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that succeeds on this save by 5 or more and has a free hand may use its reaction to catch the grenade, preventing its detonation. A giff leftenant typically carries eight grenades at a time.

action.name: Juggernaut Charge
entries: The giff attempts to shove a creature. If it succeeds, it may make another shove attempt against the same target, and continue doing so until it fails or runs out of movement. The target then takes {@damage 1d8} damage for each 5 feet it was pushed.

reaction.name: Aim, You Buffoons!
entries: As a reaction to seeing a friendly creature miss with an attack, the Giff berates its allies. Each friendly creature that can hear it gains advantage on the next attack it makes before the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Honourable Fealty
entries: While the giff is within 60 feet of a giff of higher CR, it may reroll up to two damage dice on each of its turns. If it does so, it must use the new roll.

trait.name: Null Hide
entries: The giff has resistance to damage from spells of second level or below. It cannot use or be targeted by magic items.

trait.name: Danger Close
entries: The Giff lives for the music of battle. It has resistance to damage from magical or nonmagical effects that affect a sphere or cube. If the giff fails a saving throw against such an effect, its next attack is made at advantage.

action.name: Cavalry Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flintlock Pistols
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage. The giff has a brace of eight pistols, each of which may fire once before requiring a short rest to fire again.

action.name: Pack More Powder!
entries: The giff overstuffs its musket with powder. The next shot the giff fires with it deals 6 ({@damage 1d12}) additional damage, to a maximum of 13 ({@damage 2d12}) additional damage.

action.name: Musket {@recharge 4}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage. If this attack deals 20 or more damage, the wielder takes half as much damage as fire damage.

action.name: Juggernaut Charge
entries: The giff attempts to shove a creature. If it succeeds, it may make another shove attempt against the same target, and continue doing so until it fails or runs out of movement. The target then takes {@damage 1d8} damage for each 10 feet it was pushed.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Cold Blooded
entries: If the firenewt takes cold damage, it cannot make more than one attack on its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The firenewt makes two attacks with its scimitar.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Regrow Limb
entries: THe firenewt regrows one missing limb, which bursts out in a gout of scalding steam. The firenewt regains the use of its limb, and each creature in a 15 ft. cone must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and be unable to speak or breathe until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Drop Limb
entries: As a reaction to taking 6 or more damage, the firenewt drops one of its limbs, reducing the damage taken to 5. A firenewt that drops an arm loses the use of either its scimitar or shield. A firenewt that drops a leg reduces its maximum speed by half.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, psionic abilities and illusions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Denizen of the Dark
entries: While in darkness, the duergar is {@condition invisible} to creatures that rely on darkvision to see.

action.name: War Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage while enlarged.
Reaction

action.name: Ancestral Rage
entries: As a reaction to succeeding on a saving throw against a magic or psionic effect, the duergar flies into a rage for the next minute, magically increasing its size to Large. While enraged in this way, the duergar doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Venomlink Aura
entries: A Drow, Drider, Spider, or Ettercap that starts its turn within 60 feet of the drow does an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage with each of its attacks, and its attacks have advantage against {@condition poisoned} creatures.

action.name: Wrack
entries: One creature within 5 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature's movement speed is halved.

action.name: Charnel Haze (concentration)
entries: A cloud of viscous black fog spreads from a point within 60 feet to fill a 20-foot-radius sphere for the next minute. The fog is difficult terrain and heavily obscures the area, though the drow matron's vision is not impaired by it. The drow may target creatures in or adjacent to the fog with her Wrack ability as though they were within 5 feet of her.

action.name: Tide of Dreams {@recharge 5}
entries: The drow sends a wave of soporific magic out in a 60 foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep until the end of the drow's next turn, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to wake the sleeper. A {@condition poisoned} creature makes this save at disadvantage.

reaction.name: Hazy Escape
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with a harmful spell, the drow teleports to an unoccupied space within its Charnel Haze. If it is no longer a valid target for the spell, the spell fails.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Cloak of Spiders
entries: The drow is surrounded by a swarm of venemous spiders. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the drow must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. If this damage causes a creature to make a concentration check, the creature makes it at disadvantage.

action.name: Fangblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage. This attack has advantage against a {@condition poisoned} creature.

action.name: Lolth's Favor {@recharge 5}
entries: A willing drow, or one that died since the end of the Arachnomancer's last turn, within 60 feet explodes in a torrent of venemous spiders. Each creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@dice 3d6}) piercing plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Painbond
entries: As a reaction to seeing an allied drow, drider, spider, or ettercap within 60 feet take damage, the drow may cause a second such creature to take the damage instead.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Excruciating Stab
entries: If the drow deals 20 or more damage with a single attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the drow's next turn.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: The drow makes a Scimitar attack against each creature in range.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: The drow adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. If this causes the attack to miss, the drow may make a scimitar attack as part of this reaction.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Brace of Daggers
entries: The drow has twelve daggers.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two attacks, or three attacks if it is in darkness.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Dousing Gloom
entries: Magical shadows spread from a point within 60 feet to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. Magical lights of 1st level or below in the area are extinguished, and nonmagical lights in the area produce only dim light. If the drow is hidden, this action does not reveal its position.

reaction.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the drow may halve the attack's damage if it's in dim light or darkness.

entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Dirty Fighting
entries: Attacks the drow makes at advantage deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

action.name: Darkfire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is wreathed in writhing shadows for the next minute. As long as the creature is in dim light or darkness, attacks against it are made at advantage and the creature can't benefit from invisibility.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Swamp Dweller
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water, and has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Rancid Air
entries: A creature that receives magical healing within 5 feet of one or more bullywugs must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} and {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Necessary Sacrifices
entries: If the bullywug damages an ally with either its Electric Reflux or its Fiery Croak, it may immediately roll to recharge its Electrical Reflux.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Mud Lord makes three attacks with its notched cudgel.

action.name: Notched Cudgel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. This attack deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) damage to a {@condition prone} creature.

action.name: Fiery Croak
entries: Each creature in a 15 foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@dice 3d6}) thunder and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Fire damage and be knocked {@condition prone}, or take half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Electric Reflux {@recharge 5}
entries: The bullywug retches a globule of electrochemical mucous that splashes over a 10 ft. radius within 60 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) lightning damage and be unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn, or take half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Swamp Dweller

trait.name: Standing Leap

trait.name: Frog Rider
entries: While riding a Large or larger frog, the bullywug acts on its mount's initiative, rather than rolling its own, and it has advantage on attack rolls against creatures smaller than its mount.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two attacks with its waterlogged lance.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Waterlogged Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is mounted, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. On a natural 1, this weapon shatters and the bullywug is knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Berate
entries: As a reaction to an allied creature within 30 ft. missing with an attack, the bullywug berates the ally. Each other
ally of the noble's that can hear and understand it has advantage on the first attack it makes in the next minute.

action.name: Foul Croak

action.name: Bweeie Bw Bwe
entries: A foul miasma boils from the ground around the bullywug in a 20 ft. radius. Until the end of the bullywug's next turn, each creature with the Swamp Dweller trait that starts its turn in the area adds 2 ({@dice 1d4}) to their attack rolls, and each creature without the trait that starts its turn in the area subtracts 2 ({@dice 1d4}) from its attack rolls.

action.name: Brekekekex, Koax, Koax {@recharge 5}
entries: The earth around the bullywug shudders and shifts in a 20 ft. radius, turning any difficult terrain hazardous. A creature not native to a swamp that starts its turn in difficult terrain in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 13}).

entries: As a reaction to a creature making an attack of opportunity against it, the bullywug makes a kick attack against the attacker.

entries: The bugbear has advantage on attack rolls against creatures with no adjacent allies.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Raid Leader
entries: Friendly bugbears witin 30 ft. may use the raid leader's attack bonus instead of their own.

trait.name: Birdcall Coordination
entries: The bugbear and its allies can communicate simple ideas over up to 120 ft. without alerting enemies to their presence. On the first turn of combat, each bugbear within 60 ft of the chieftian may act on the highest initiative rolled among them, rather than on their own.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two attacks with its machete and uses its fade away, if available.

action.name: Machete
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If this attack was made with advantage, the target begins to bleed. At the beginning of each of its turns, an affected creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, losing {@dice 1d4} hit points on a failure, or ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Fade Away {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to three friendly bugbears within 60 may each use their reactions to move up to half their speed and take the Hide action.

trait.name: Predatory Eye
entries: The bugbear has advantage on attack rolls against creatures with no adjacent allies.

trait.name: Surprise Attack

trait.name: Trapdoor Tunneler
entries: The bugbear leaves a 5-ft.-diameter tunnel in its wake while burrowing. Over the course of an hour, the bugbear can construct a trapdoor of vegetation and debris that makes an opening up to 5 ft. across indistinguishable from natural terrain.. Creatures using the tunnels to hide gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two attacks with its skullthumper.

action.name: Skullthumper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If this attack was made with advantage, the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution Saving Throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and unable to stand on its next turn.

action.name: Collapse Tunnel (1/Day)
entries: The bugbear causes up to 20 ft. of a 5 ft. diameter tunnel within 20 ft. to collapse. Creatures inside the collapsed portion are {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, and cannot speak or breathe. As an action, a creature may attempt a {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check, clearing 5 ft. of the collapse and freeing any creatures in the cleared area on a success.

entries: The bugbear has advantage on attack rolls against creatures with no adjacent allies.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Skilled Ambusher
entries: The bugbear can attempt to hide without concealment in natural environments as long as it has 1 minute to prepare.

action.name: Garotte
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, a creature is unable to speak or breathe. If the attack was made at advantage, the target immediately begins to suffocate.

action.name: Throttle
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the bugbear must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) slashing damage, or half as much on a success.

entries: The bugbear has advantage on attack rolls against creatures with no adjacent allies.

trait.name: Surprise Attack

trait.name: Indistinct
entries: The thicket shura does not reveal its position automatically when it is hidden and makes a ranged attack. Instead, a creature must discover its position by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Perception (Wisdom) check as an action.

trait.name: Vicious Attack
entries: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack scores a critical on an 19 or 20.

trait.name: Brittle Bones
entries: If the aarakocra starts its turn {@condition grappled}, it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The aarakocra doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aarakocra makes three attacks with its shocking claw.

action.name: Shocking Claw
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Fury of the Storm {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 120 ft. that is flying is pushed up to 15 ft. in a direction of the aarakocra's choice. Then, each creature in a 10 ft. radius, 100 ft. high cylinder within 120 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage, or half as much on a success.

reaction.name: Take Flight
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee attack, the aarakocra moves up to half its fly speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Vicious Attack
entries: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack scores a critical on an 19 or 20.

trait.name: Brittle Bones

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Flight Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target is knocked {@condition prone} if it is a medium or smaller creature.

reaction.name: Take Flight
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee attack, the aarakocra moves up to half its fly speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

resist.note: from weapons that aren't either silvered or named.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Illusory Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic the voice or appearance of any animal or humanoid it knows the name of. A creature can discern the nature of this illusion with a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Debt Keeper
entries: A creature that is indebted to the hag is psychically connected to it. The hag can telepathically communicate with it over any distance and can choose to perceive through its senses. Once per day, the hag can force an indebted creature to reroll an attack, ability check, or saving throw, taking the second result.

trait.name: Soultaker Coven
entries: Humanoid creatures within 100 miles of a coven of night hags feel drawn to the coven's location in times of desperation. While part of a coven, the hag's hellish portal does not close when a creature falls into it.

trait.name: Soporific Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the hag's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag, the hag can force it to succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep until it takes any damage, or until another creature uses its action to wake it. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effect for the next 24 hours.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the  saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the hag until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

trait.name: Legendary Soultaker (3/Day)
entries: If the hag fails a saving throw, it can choose to release one of the souls it has trapped in its soul bag. If it does, it succeeds instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Fiendish Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Hellish Portal {@recharge 5}
entries: The hag opens a rift to a hellish demplane, 10 ft. long and 5 ft. wide, on a surface within 60 ft. A creature standing in the rift's space when it appears or that enters it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dextery saving throw or fall {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space adjacent to the rift. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more falls in. If one or more creatures fall into the rift, the rift closes.

A creature that falls into the rift takes 31 ({@damage 9d6}) psychic damage, 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage, and ages 31 ({@dice 9d6}) years, and is {@condition incapacitated} until the beginning of its next turn, when it reappears in the space it left. The aging Effect can be reversed with a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane, afflicting it with dreadful nightmares. If this contact persists for an hour, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 10 ({@dice 2d10}).

If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was indebted to the hag, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

A creature that is wearing a silver protective talsiman, or one that has had a Protection From Good And Evil spell cast on it in the last 8 hours makes this save at advantage. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw by 5 or more awakes, dragging the hag into the waking world with it. The hag appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and cannot use its Etherealness ability for the next minute.

reaction.name: Offer Bargain
entries: As a reaction to a creature it can see  failing a saving throw, the hag grants it the ability to choose to succeed instead. A creature that does is Indebted to the hag.

reaction.name: True Magic
entries: As a reaction to a creature it can see wihthin 60 ft. casting a spell, the hag disrupts the magic. The spell fails, and the spell caster takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage per level of the spell and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned}.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Illusory Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic the voice or appearance of any animal or humanoid it knows the name of. A creature can discern the nature of these illusions with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Debt Keeper
entries: A creature that is indebted to the hag is psychically connected to it. The hag can telepathically communicate with it over any distance and can choose to perceive through its senses. Once per day, the hag can force an indebted creature to reroll an attack, ability check, or saving throw, taking the second result.

trait.name: Soultaker Coven
entries: Humanoid creatures within 100 miles of a coven of night hags feel drawn to the coven's location in times of desperation. While part of a coven, the hag's hellish portal does not close when a creature falls into it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Fiendish Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Hellish Portal {@recharge 5}
entries: The hag opens a rift to a hellish demplane, 10 ft. long and 5 ft. wide, on a surface within 60 ft. A creature standing in the rift's space when it appears or that enters it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dextery saving throw or fall {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space adjacent to the rift. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more falls in. If one or more creatures fall into the rift, the rift closes.

A creature that falls into the rift takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage, 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage, and ages 21 ({@dice 6d6}) years, and is {@condition incapacitated} until the beginning of its next turn, when it reappears in the space it left. The aging Effect can be reversed with a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a heartstone in her possession.

action.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane, afflicting it with dreadful nightmares. If this contact persists for an hour, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 ({@dice 1d10}).

If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was indebted to the hag, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

A creature that is wearing a silver protective talsiman, or one that has had a Protection From Good And Evil spell cast on it in the last 8 hours makes this save at advantage. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw by 5 or more awakes, dragging the hag into the waking world with it. The hag appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and cannot use its Etherealness ability for the next minute.

reaction.name: Offer Bargain
entries: As a reaction to a creature it can see  failing a saving throw, the hag grants it the ability to choose to succeed instead. A creature that does is Indebted to the hag.

reaction.name: True Magic (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to a creature it can see wihthin 60 ft. casting a spell, the hag disrupts the magic. The spell fails, and the spell caster takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage per level of the spell and must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned}.

resist.note: from attacks with weapons that aren't named

trait.name: Fey Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects imposed by a creature that does not know its name.

trait.name: Swampwalk
entries: The hag is unaffected by difficult terrain caused by swampy terrain or vegetation.

trait.name: Illusory Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic the voice or appearance of any animal or humanoid it has killed. A creature can discern the nature of these illusions with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Glimmer of Hope
entries: Whenever one or more creatures the hag can see within 30 ft. succeed on a saving throw against a spell the hag controls, the hag gains 11 ({@dice 2d10}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Earthdrinker Coven
entries: The earth within 10 miles of a coven of green hags gradually softens and becomes waterlogged over the course of a week. The roots of food crops begin to rot away, livestock sicken, and the area becomes difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag makes two melee attacks, one of which she may replace with either her Hurl to Earth or her Grasping Muck.

action.name: Swampgift Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be cursed.
While cursed, a creature glows with a pale blue light, attracts biting insects, and swamp-dwelling creatures have advantage on attack rolls against the cursed creature.

action.name: Hurl to Earth
entries: One creature within 60 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be teleported 60 ft. in the air and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Grasping Muck
entries: One creature within 60 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 15}) as it begins to sink into the earth. A {@condition prone} creature has disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature already affected by this ability is additionally {@condition blinded} and unable to speak or breathe as it sinks fully beneath the surface.

action.name: Stagnant Miasma {@recharge 5}
entries: The ground in a 10 ft. radius within 60 ft. begins to bubble, exuding a cloud of toxic gas that remains for a minute, or until cleared with a strong breeze. A creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Invisible Passage (Concentration)
entries: The hag magically turns {@condition invisible} until she attacks or casts a spell. While {@condition invisible}, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic.

reaction.name: Poisoned Cup
entries: As a reaction to a creature she can see within 30 ft. receiving a source of magical healing, the hag fouls the magic. The creature receives no healing and instead takes an equal amount of necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Hope to Despair
entries: When a creature that the hag can see within 30 ft. makes a saving throw against a spell the hag (or a member of her coven) cast, she may expend all temporary hit points from her Glimmer of Hope ability and subtract the number expended from the creature's saving throw.

trait.name: Fey Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects imposed by a creature that does not know its name.

trait.name: Swampwalk
entries: The hag is unaffected by difficult terrain caused by swampy terrain or vegetation.

trait.name: Illusory Mimicry

A creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.

entries: When a creature that the hag can see within 30 ft. makes a saving throw against a spell the hag (or a member of her coven) cast, she may expend all temporary hit points from her Glimmer of Hope ability and subtract the number expended from the creature's saving throw.

resist.note: from attacks with weapons that aren't named

trait.name: Graystaff Magic
entries: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag cannot use its rime burst and must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost her extra moment.

trait.name: Sapping Cold
entries: Each time a creature hits the bheur hag with a melee attack, it must expend one unexpended hit die. If it cannot, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end its next turn.

trait.name: Embrittle
entries: On a roll of 1 with a melee attack agains the hag, a weapon that isn't named shatters in the wielder's hands, dealing 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Wintergiver Coven
entries: The area within 50 miles of a coven of bheur hags drops 1 degree every hour until it reaches 10 degrees below the lowest natural winter temperature of the area. Creatures in the area without cold resistance or immunity subtract {@dice 1d4} from the result of saving throws they make.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag uses its Rime Burst or Maddening Feast. Then, if one or more creatures within 30 ft. are {@condition frightened}, it may use its Onset of Desperation or Curse of Paranoia.

action.name: Rime Burst (Greystaff only)
entries: The hag sends forth an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes difficult terrain, and a creatue that starts its turn in it or enters the area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Maddening Feast
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one incacitated or dead target. *Hit* 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage and 36 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage. Each creature of the hag's choice that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for a minute. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Onset of Desperation
entries: One {@condition frightened} creature within 30 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the hag for the same duration. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature uses its action to feed on the nearest beast or humanoid corpse it can see within 30 ft., or to attack the nearest living humanoid or beast it can see if there are no corpses in range.

action.name: Curse of Paranoia
entries: Each {@condition frightened} creature within 30 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature cannot target friendly creatures with spells. If the cursed creature is targeted with a spell by a friendly creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unaffected by the spell.

reaction.name: Feed on Greed
entries: As a reaction to a creature within 60 ft. targeting itself with a spell, the bhuer hag changes the spell's target to itself.

reaction.name: Chill the Weave
entries: As a reaction to a creature within 60 ft targeting the hag with a spell, the hag forces the caster to expend an additonal spell slot of the same or higher level. If it cannot, the hag chooses a new target for the spell.

trait.name: Graystaff Magic
entries: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag cannot use its rime burst and must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

A {@condition frightened} creature repeats this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

If the cursed creature is targeted with a spell by a friendly creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unaffected by the spell.

trait.name: Skinktaker Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic the voice or appearance of any humanoid it has skinned. A creature can discern the nature of these illusions with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Corruptor Coven
entries: Children within 10 miles of a coven of annis hags are slowly incited to misbehave in ever-escalating ways, up to and including things like destruction of food stores, killing pets and livestock, arson, and even murder.
Additionally, a fog settles in the area that never lifts. Creatures other than the annis hag in the area are blind beyond a 30 ft. radius.

trait.name: Eyes of Black
entries: A creature the hag can see must spend 1 extra foot for every foot it moves away from the hag.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The annis makes three attacks: one with her teeth of iron and two with her corkscrew claws.

action.name: Teeth of Iron
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage. This attack deals an additonal 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage against a {@condition prone} creature.

action.name: Corkscrew Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage and the hag may grapple the target (escape {@dc 19}). While the hag has a creature {@condition grappled} in this way, it cannot use its multiattack.

action.name: Crushing Hug
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the hag must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) bludgeoning damage, falls {@condition prone}, and cannot stand on its following turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more cannot stand until it completes a short or long rest. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

reaction.name: Grisly Display
entries: As a reaction when the hag kills a creature with a melee attack, the hag rips the creature's skin off in a single piece. Each creature that can see the display must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom save or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature uses its movement and action to dash in a random direction.

reaction.name: Swallow Magic
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with a spell of fifth level or below, the hag snaps at the spell with her iron teeth, disrupting it. On her following turn, the annis hag's attacks are made at advantage and deal force damage, instead of any other type.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The troll can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Weapons
entries: The troll's attacks treat all creatures as unarmored (an unarmored creature's AC is usually 10 plus its Dexterity modifier.)

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes 10 or more fire, force, or psychic damage from a single source, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Budding
entries: When the troll suffers a critical hit that deals slashing or piercing damage, one of its limbs is severed, giving it disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws. At the end of each of its turns, the troll makes a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a success, this condition ends, and the severed piece grows into a new troll with 1 HP. The severed limb is destroyed if it takes any fire or force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be disoriented until the end of its next turn. If a disoriented creature misses with an attack, it makes a new attack roll against another creature in range, if available.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Strangle
entries: One creature within 5 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, a creature cannot speak or breathe. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more cannot hold its breath. A creature that cannot see the troll makes this save at disadvantage.

reaction.name: Wraithform (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 67 hit points, the troll becomes {@condition invisible}, and each hostile creature within 30 ft. must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature must use all of its movement on its following turn to move away from the troll.
The troll remains {@condition invisible} until it damages a creature, or until it regains all of its hit points.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Poison Splash
entries: When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Poison Reliance
entries: If it would be subjected to an effect that would neutralize poison, the venom troll instead must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage, or half as much on a success..

The severed limb is destroyed if it takes acid or fire damage.

action.name: Reckless Sweep

Until the begining of its next turn, attacks that target the troll are made at advantage.

action.name: Reckless Sweep

Until the begining of its next turn, attacks that target the troll are made at advantage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni uses makes one blade attack and uses its invisibility.

action.name: Hidden Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 10 feet away. This attack deals an additional 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage if it was made with advantage.

action.name: Freezing Blast (1/Day, 5th level spell)
entries: Each creature in a 60 ft cone must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 41 ({@damage 9d8}) cold damage, or half damage on a success.

action.name: Lightning Strike
entries: Creatures in a 5 ft radius of a point within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Creeping Sleep
entries: Up to two creatures within 15 feet must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature falls asleep until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more instead falls asleep for the next minute. A creature wakes up early if it takes damage or another creature uses its action to wake it.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a cloud of black mist, or back into its true form. In its mist form, it cannot make attacks, has resistance to weapon damage, and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The oni becomes {@condition invisible} until it takes another action.

reaction.name: Mutable Form
entries: As a reaction to taking 15 or more damage from a single source, the Oni may use is change shape ability.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni uses its creeping sleep ability once and its devour soul ability once.

action.name: Hidden Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 10 feet away.

action.name: Creeping Sleep
entries: One creature within 15 feet must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature falls asleep until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more instead falls asleep for the next minute. A creature wakes up early if it takes damage or another creature uses its action to wake it.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a cloud of black mist, or back into its true form. In its mist form, it cannot take actions, has resistance to weapon damage, and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.

action.name: Devour Soul
entries: One sleeping creature within 5 feet of the oni must make succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) psychic damage. This damage does not wake the creature. A creature that succeeds takes half damage, and does wake up.

reaction.name: Mutable Form
entries: As a reaction to taking 15 or more damage from a single source, the Oni may use is change shape ability.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

Its statistics remain the same, except that as a head it has an AC of 18, and cannot use its multiattack. If the oni has 38 or more hit points, it may reattach its head as a bonus action.

trait.name: Juggernaut
entries: The ogre may attempt to shove a creature as a bonus action. If it moves 20 feet before attempting to shove a creature, the ogre has advantage on the contested check, and on a success the target is knocked {@condition prone} and pushed 10 feet back.

trait.name: Spell Resistant Hide
entries: The ogre has resistance to damage from spells of third level or below.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. This attack deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) damage to a {@condition prone} creature.

action.name: Juggernaut Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The ogre attempts to shove a creature. If it succeeds, it may make another shove attempt against the same target, and continue doing so until it fails or runs out of movement. The target then takes {@damage 1d8} damage for each 5 feet it was pushed.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Huge Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the giant may spend half of its movement to attempt a {@dc 17} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the giant. While climbing on the giant, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against the giant, and the giant has disadvantage on melee attacks against it.

action.name: Rock

A creature that is climbing on the giant has disadvantage on the save, and takes maximum damage if it fails. A creature that succeeds takes half damage, but may use its reaction to move up to ten feet, taking no damage if it ends this movement outside the area of effect. The giant can't stand from {@condition prone} this turn.

reaction.name: Kick Away
entries: As a reaction to a creature ending its movement within 5 feet of the giant, the giant forces it to succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}, pushed 10 feet away, and lose concentration if it was holding it.

On a failed save, the creature subtracts {@dice 1d4} from any attacks or saving throws it makes until the beginning of its next turn. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the fomorian until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity.
